original: ji ltar yang goondi n+ya la dar ba byin la /
analyzed: ji ltar yang goondi n+ya la dar ba byin la /
translated: For example, the statement, ‚ÄúGive yogurt to Gautama,

original: bram ze thams cad la zho byin cig ces zho sbyin pa spyir 'jug pa dang dar ba sbyin pa khyad par du bsgrubs pas gnod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bram ze thams cad la zho byin cig ces zho sbyin pa spyir 'jug pa dang dar ba sbyin pa khyad par du bsgrubs pas gnod pa bzhin te /
translated: and give curd to all brahmins,‚Äù is a general statement about giving curd, and a specific statement about giving yogurt.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul bzhag ste /üîΩspyir btang ba ni 'jug pa yin zhes so //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul bzhag ste / spyir btang ba ni 'jug pa yin zhes so //
translated: The general statement is overridden by the specific statement.

original: de'i phyir spyi rjes su 'jug pa khyad par de khyab pa ma yin no //üîΩspyi rjes su 'jug pa la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi rjes su 'jug pa khyad par de khyab pa ma yin no // spyi rjes su 'jug pa la ni /
translated: Therefore, the general statement is overridden by the specific statement, but the specific statement does not override the general statement.

original: 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no result of the general statement being overridden by the specific statement.

original: 'di ni tshig gi shugs kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni tshig gi shugs kyis yin te /
translated: This is the force of the words,

original: tshigs ni skabs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs ni skabs dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the context is complete.

original: gal te don 'di 'dod pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te don 'di 'dod pa yin na ni /
translated: If this is what you assert,

original: de'i tshe sgra ni rtag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra ni rtag ste /
translated: then you should say, ‚ÄúSound is permanent,

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is impermanent.‚ÄùüîΩBut the specific statements that are not intended to have a meaning

original: gzhan du don du ma byas pa'i khyad par dag gi ni yul gcig la 'jug pa yang yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du don du ma byas pa'i khyad par dag gi ni yul gcig la 'jug pa yang yin no //
translated: can have the same referent.

original: de ltar yin dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, there would be a contradiction.

original: rmongs pa'i phyir de ltar yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i phyir de ltar yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so because of delusion,

original: de lta bu ni 'ga' yang mi srid de /
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'ga' yang mi srid de /
translated: then that is impossible.

original: de nyid du rtag pa nyid bsgrubs nas de nyid kyi tshe yang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa'i rmongs pa ni mi srid do //
analyzed: de nyid du rtag pa nyid bsgrubs nas de nyid kyi tshe yang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa'i rmongs pa ni mi srid do //
translated: For it is impossible to be deluded about something that is established as permanent at one time and impermanent at another time.

original: gang la dag byang btsam yang med pa de ni rtsod pa la dbang du bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la dag byang btsam yang med pa de ni rtsod pa la dbang du bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And one who has no knowledge of even that much is not fit to debate.

original: 'on te dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i dpe 'ga' zhig ji ltar rung ba'ang brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i dpe 'ga' zhig ji ltar rung ba'ang brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: But if you say that it is possible to imagine some example where the thesis and reason are contradictory,

original: brgya la 'ga' zhig 'di skad brjod na /
analyzed: brgya la 'ga' zhig 'di skad brjod na /
translated: then it might be said:

original: de'i tshe dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe dam bca' ba dang / gtan tshigs 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time, the thesis and reason are contradictory.

original: dam bca' 'gal ba'i skyon yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: dam bca' 'gal ba'i skyon yin no zhe na ;
translated: The fault is that the thesis is contradictory.‚Äù

original: de'i tshe ni 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: But at that time, that is exactly what we want to prove.

original: sbyor ba ni sgra rtag ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sgra rtag ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni nges pa'i phyir sgra nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni nges pa'i phyir sgra nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then sound itself is established.

original: des na rtag pa nyid bsal bas skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag pa nyid bsal bas skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since permanence is refuted, there is a fault.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /üîΩde'i phyir sgra las gnas pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa / de'i phyir sgra las gnas pa yi //
translated: For this very reason, it is said:üîΩTherefore, it is said that

original: mi rtag nyid kyis sel zhes gsungs //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid kyis sel zhes gsungs //
translated: impermanence refutes endurance in sound.

original: slob dpon gyis gal te sgra la gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gal te sgra la gnas pa yin na /
translated: The master says: If sound endures,

original: 'dir gtan tshigs skyis dam bca' ba'i don sel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir gtan tshigs skyis dam bca' ba'i don sel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the meaning of the thesis is refuted by the reason.

original: sgra la gnas pa nyid kyis ni sel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra la gnas pa nyid kyis ni sel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Endurance in sound is refuted because

original: 'gal ba dag lhan cig tu mi gnas pa 'di ni gzhan du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag lhan cig tu mi gnas pa 'di ni gzhan du bstan pa yin te /
translated: it is taught elsewhere that contradictions do not endure together.

original: des @208b na sel ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des @208b na sel ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not refuted by that.

original: des na 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: des na 'di ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpes bstan pa tsam du zad do //
translated: Therefore, this is merely an example of a dissimilar example.

original: de ni gtan tshigs med par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩbshad pa / gtan tshigs nyer gtong bdag nyid las //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs med par 'gyur ro zhe na / bshad pa / gtan tshigs nyer gtong bdag nyid las //
translated: If you say that it would be a reason,üîΩit is said:üîΩThe example is that which is stated

original: gang du lda pas bsgrub bya yi //
analyzed: gang du lda pas bsgrub bya yi //
translated: in the thesis where the reason

original: mi mthun phyogs la mi 'khrul pa //üîΩbrjod pa de ni dpe yin te //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la mi 'khrul pa //üîΩbrjod pa de ni dpe yin te //
translated: is not confused about the opposite.

original: gtan tshigs nyer gtod bdag nyid las gang mi rtag pa de ni thams cad yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyer gtod bdag nyid las gang mi rtag pa de ni thams cad yin la /
translated: The reason is: Whatever is impermanent is all of it.

original: sgra ni thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Sound is not all of it.üîΩHow is this understood?

original: 'di ltar rtogs she na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs she na bshad pa /
translated: It is said:

original: yul gzhan la ni 'gal smra bas //
analyzed: yul gzhan la ni 'gal smra bas //
translated: The opponent speaks of an object other than sound,

original: sgra ni gzhan du brjod pa yin //
analyzed: sgra ni gzhan du brjod pa yin //
translated: Sound is spoken of as other.

original: spyi ni khyad par mi smod phyir //
analyzed: spyi ni khyad par mi smod phyir //
translated: Because the universal is not denied by the particular,

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: That is also not tenable.

original: rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa sgra las gzhan pa'i yul la smra ba nyid kyis sgra gzhan du smra ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dang 'gal ba mi rtag pa sgra las gzhan pa'i yul la smra ba nyid kyis sgra gzhan du smra ba yin no //
translated: The opponent speaks of impermanence, which is contradictory with permanence, as the object of sound, and thus speaks of sound as other.

original: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab par yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab par yin no //
translated: Because all is pervaded by impermanence,

original: sgra ni rtag pa'i phyir de las gzhan no zhes thams cad ma yin pa nyid ni 'di'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni rtag pa'i phyir de las gzhan no zhes thams cad ma yin pa nyid ni 'di'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Sound is not all of it because it is permanent, and this is the reason.

original: gzhan nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because otherness is taught.

original: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid de yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan nyid de yang ma grub ste /
translated: That reason of otherness is also unestablished,

original: sgra yang thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni //
analyzed: sgra yang thams cad yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni //
translated: Because sound is all of it.

original: spyi ni khyad par mi spong phyir //
analyzed: spyi ni khyad par mi spong phyir //
translated: because the universal is not distinct from the particulars.

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not tenable.

original: khyad par spangs na ni spyi'i bdag nyid rnyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par spangs na ni spyi'i bdag nyid rnyed pa ma yin te /
translated: If the particulars are excluded, the universal is not perceived,

original: khyad par rnams nyid kyi nang gi khyad par spangs pa'i yul la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnams nyid kyi nang gi khyad par spangs pa'i yul la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the particulars are ascertained as being excluded from the objects of the other particulars.

original: 'on te thams cad kyi sgras ni tshad ba brjod pa yin na sgra ni phyogs gcig yin pas tshang ba nyid ma yin no snyam na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyi sgras ni tshad ba brjod pa yin na sgra ni phyogs gcig yin pas tshang ba nyid ma yin no snyam na de ni ma yin te /
translated: But if the word all refers to the particulars, then sound is not all, because it is one part.

original: de ltar na so sor bsal na 'ga' yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na so sor bsal na 'ga' yang thams cad du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not so, because if it is excluded in each case, then nothing is all.

original: shing sha pa nyid ni shing ma yin no zhes khyad par spong ba mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: shing sha pa nyid ni shing ma yin no zhes khyad par spong ba mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But we see that the exclusion of the particulars is expressed, as in the statement, A ≈õim≈õapƒÅ is not a tree.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dper na skabs 'gar shing sha pa //
analyzed: dper na skabs 'gar shing sha pa //
translated: For example, sometimes a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ

original: nyid ni shing min zhes pa bzhin //
analyzed: nyid ni shing min zhes pa bzhin //
translated: is not a tree.

original: thams cad mnyan pa gcig nyid la //
analyzed: thams cad mnyan pa gcig nyid la //
translated: In the case of all that is heard,

original: 'jug pa 'gog 'gyur de tsam gyis //
analyzed: 'jug pa 'gog 'gyur de tsam gyis //
translated: the engagement is stopped by just that much.

original: thams cad med min khyad par kun //
analyzed: thams cad med min khyad par kun //
translated: All is not nonexistent, because of all the particulars.

original: de min na de med 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: de min na de med 'gyur phyir //
translated: Otherwise, it would not exist.

original: 'on te brjod par 'dod pas sgra gcig pu nyid thams cad ma yin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brjod par 'dod pas sgra gcig pu nyid thams cad ma yin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is not everything,

original: de ltar yin na thams cad ma yin pa'i sgra sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyis phyogs gcig yin pas ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na thams cad ma yin pa'i sgra sgra'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba'i don gyis phyogs gcig yin pas ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: then, since the word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is a synonym of the word ‚Äúeverything,‚Äù the meaning of the proposition is one part of the reason, and so the reason is not established.

original: sgra mi rtag pa ste bcom pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa ste bcom pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the argument, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is destroyed.‚Äù

original: @209a * // gal te sgra la bcom nyid ji ltar ma grub rang gi ngo bo med par ni 'ga' yang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @209a * // gal te sgra la bcom nyid ji ltar ma grub rang gi ngo bo med par ni 'ga' yang yod par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúHow is it that the fact that sound is destroyed is not established? Nothing exists without its own nature.‚Äù

original: ma yin te chos can gyi rang gi ngo bor grub mod kyi /
analyzed: ma yin te chos can gyi rang gi ngo bor grub mod kyi /
translated: No, it is not so. The nature of the subject is established.

original: gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub par brjod do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub par brjod do //
translated: But we say that the reason is not established because it is not established as a reason.

original: gtan tshig nyid ni tha dad pa yin na 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshig nyid ni tha dad pa yin na 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The reason is established as a reason if it is different, but not if it is not different.

original: ga las she na shas bya shes byed ni gor ma chag par tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga las she na shas bya shes byed ni gor ma chag par tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the object of cognition and the cognition are certainly different.

original: sgra ni sgras shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni sgras shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not to be cognized by sound,

original: shes par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par bya ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object to be cognized is not established.

original: ma grub pa ni ma grub pas sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni ma grub pas sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And what is not established does not establish what is not established.

original: de ste grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de ste grub po zhe na /
translated: If it is established,

original: de lta na yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: then it is not to be established.

original: grub pa ni sgrub pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: grub pa ni sgrub pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And what is established is not to be established by a proof.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs gcig tu mi 'dod mod chos can dang sgrub par byed pa gcig pa la 'gal ba yod ce na /üîΩ'gal ba yod de sgra yod pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod na tshogs pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs gcig tu mi 'dod mod chos can dang sgrub par byed pa gcig pa la 'gal ba yod ce na / 'gal ba yod de sgra yod pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod na tshogs pa bsgrub byar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that the object to be established and the proof are the same, but you do accept that there is a contradiction in the subject and the proof being the same,üîΩthen there is a contradiction, because if you say ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it exists,‚Äù then the collection is not the object to be established.

original: gal te shugs kyis sgra nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshogs pa nyams pa med do //
analyzed: gal te shugs kyis sgra nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshogs pa nyams pa med do //
translated: If you say ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is a sound,‚Äù then the collection is not impaired, because sound itself becomes impermanent by implication.

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod pas na /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod pas na /
translated: If you say ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it exists,‚Äù

original: gzhan la mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan la mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs pa 'am /
translated: It is not that one understands impermanence in relation to something else,

original: 'ba' zhig rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: or that one understands it alone.

original: du ba yin pa'i phyir du ba med dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ba yin pa'i phyir du ba med dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not that because of being smoke, one does not possess the absence of fire.

original: de la ni spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la ni spyi dang khyad par gyi ngo bos tha dad pa yod pa'i phyir 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: In that case, it is just as it should be, because there is a difference in the nature of the general and the particular.

original: 'dir yang gal te sgra 'di ni rtag ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te sgra 'di ni rtag ste /
translated: Here, if one argues that sound is permanent,

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gzhan no zhes de ltar byed na de'i tshe gtan tshig su gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir ba lang gi sgra gzhan no zhes de ltar byed na de'i tshe gtan tshig su gyur ba zhig na /
translated: because it is sound, like the sound of a cow, then at that time the reason is inconclusive.

original: 'dir ni sgra thams cad ni rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni sgra thams cad ni rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po med pa nyid do //
translated: But here, all sound is permanent, because it is sound, there is no such thing as a general and particular entity.

original: gal te sgra chos can nyid sgrub par byed pa yin pa ci 'gal /
analyzed: gal te sgra chos can nyid sgrub par byed pa yin pa ci 'gal /
translated: If the subject itself is what is to be established, what is the contradiction?

original: gal te 'brel pa yod na ci ltar sgrub byed ma yin /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa yod na ci ltar sgrub byed ma yin /
translated: If there is a connection, why is it not what is to be established?

original: ci ste yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang med do zhe na /
translated: But if it does not exist,

original: de ltar yin na ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: then it is just as it should be, because it is not ascertained.

original: des na ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'i skyon ni med de /
analyzed: des na ma grub pa nyid ces bya ba'i skyon ni med de /
translated: Therefore, the error called ‚Äúunproven‚Äù does not exist.

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the uncommonness, there is no certainty.

original: des na chos can gtan tshigs yin pa la ni ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: des na chos can gtan tshigs yin pa la ni ma nges pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur gyis /
translated: Therefore, when the subject is the reason, the error of ‚Äúuncertain‚Äù occurs,

original: ma grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the error of ‚Äúunproven.‚Äù

original: 'on te yang bstan par bya ba nyid dang ldan par ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te yang bstan par bya ba nyid dang ldan par ma grub pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin no zhes brjod de /
translated: But if you say that it is unproven because it is not established as having the nature of the probandum,

original: 'di ltar gang zhig @209b yang bstan par bya ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩde la sgra mi rtag go zhes sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig @209b yang bstan par bya ba'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no // de la sgra mi rtag go zhes sam /
translated: then it is not so, because there is no particular probandum.üîΩIn that case, one should say, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù

original: sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: or ‚ÄúIt is impermanent because it is sound,‚Äù

original: yang brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not ‚ÄúIt is not to be said again.‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: sgra ni mi rtag ces brjod na //
analyzed: sgra ni mi rtag ces brjod na //
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gzhan la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: then one would rely on another reason.

original: de spang phyir na sgra yin zhes //
analyzed: de spang phyir na sgra yin zhes //
translated: In order to avoid that, one says, ‚ÄúIt is sound,‚Äù

original: bya ba 'di ni yang brjod do //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni yang brjod do //
translated: This is the same as the previous statement.

original: sgra yin phyir na 'jog go zhes //
analyzed: sgra yin phyir na 'jog go zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is sound, it is established.‚Äù

original: 'di yang sgra yin sgra sbyar ba //üîΩchos can gzhan ni sel ba la //
analyzed: 'di yang sgra yin sgra sbyar ba // chos can gzhan ni sel ba la //
translated: This is the same as the previous statement.üîΩThe other subject is related

original: nus pa dang ni 'brel pa yin //
analyzed: nus pa dang ni 'brel pa yin //
translated: to the capacity of the reason.

original: gal te sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te sgra yin pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is sound, it is impermanent,‚Äù

original: chos can gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: chos can gzhan la ltos par 'gyur bas na /
translated: then it would depend on another subject.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir gnyi gar nye bar bkod pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir gnyi gar nye bar bkod pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that, both are stated, and there is no fault.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te sgra nyid nus na ni //
analyzed: gal te sgra nyid nus na ni //
translated: If sound itself has the capacity,

original: gtan tis gzhan dag don med yin //
analyzed: gtan tis gzhan dag don med yin //
translated: the other reason is meaningless.

original: 'on te nus pa med phyir na //
analyzed: 'on te nus pa med phyir na //
translated: But if it lacks the capacity,

original: yang brjod des ni ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yang brjod des ni ci zhig bya //
translated: what is the use of stating it again?

original: de'i phyir yang bstan pa la brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de 'dir med pa'i phyir na ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang bstan pa la brjod par 'dod pa gang yin pa de 'dir med pa'i phyir na ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yin no //
translated: Therefore, since what is intended to be stated here is absent, the fault of non-establishment still remains.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi skyon 'di la ci ste mi brjod ce na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi skyon 'di la ci ste mi brjod ce na /
translated: Why is the fault of lack of pervasion not stated here?

original: nyas pa de yang bsdu ba'i sgo nas nyes pa med par brjod pa'i skabs su 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: nyas pa de yang bsdu ba'i sgo nas nyes pa med par brjod pa'i skabs su 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, that fault is not committed when the fault is stated in terms of the inclusion.

original: nges par brjod pa'i skabs su ni pham zin pa la pham pa med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags la ltos pa'i phyir na rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par brjod pa'i skabs su ni pham zin pa la pham pa med pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtags la ltos pa'i phyir na rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the context of the statement of the thesis, it is not correct, because the defeat has already occurred, and because it depends on the objection and examination.

original: de'i phyir chos can ni rang gi chos kyi sgrub byed du mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can ni rang gi chos kyi sgrub byed du mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct that the subject is the probandum of its own property.

original: nus so zhe na ni rtsod pa med par thal la /
analyzed: nus so zhe na ni rtsod pa med par thal la /
translated: If it is possible, then it follows, absurdly, that there is no debate.

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs don med par 'gyur ro //üîΩdas na / shes bya shes byed tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs don med par 'gyur ro // das na / shes bya shes byed tha dad phyir //
translated: Even if that were the case, the reason would be pointless.

original: chos can gtan tshigs dngos 'gyur na //
analyzed: chos can gtan tshigs dngos 'gyur na //
translated: If the subject were the reason,üîΩthen the subject would not be established as the probandum,

original: shes byed nyid du ma grub phyir //üîΩchos can rang sgrub byed ma grub //
analyzed: shes byed nyid du ma grub phyir // chos can rang sgrub byed ma grub //
translated: because the subject and the object of knowledge are different.

original: shes bya shes byed ni tha dad par mthong bas /
analyzed: shes bya shes byed ni tha dad par mthong bas /
translated: The object of knowledge and the knower are seen to be different.

original: de med na gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de med na gtan tshigs nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: If that were not so, then the reason would not be established.

original: gsal ba nyid kyis gsal byed du gyur ba'i mar me ni /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyis gsal byed du gyur ba'i mar me ni /
translated: The lamp, which is manifest, is the illuminator.

original: rang bzhin de ma rtogs na rang gi don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin de ma rtogs na rang gi don bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: If that intrinsic reality is not understood, it is not possible to accomplish one‚Äôs own aim.

original: shes par byed na ni tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: shes par byed na ni tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If it is understood, it is distinct.

original: shes bya shes par byed pa yin na 'dir ni chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya shes par byed pa yin na 'dir ni chos can gyi rang bzhin las tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But here, the intrinsic reality of the subject is not distinct.

original: des na shes par byed pa nyid du ma grub pas ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes par byed pa nyid du ma grub pas ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not established as that which is understood, it is not established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa las kyang shes par byed pa nyid du ma grub par @210a * //üîΩ'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa las kyang shes par byed pa nyid du ma grub par @210a * // 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is not concomitant, it is not established as that which is understood.

original: tha dad na rjes su 'gro ba sems par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tha dad na rjes su 'gro ba sems par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were distinct, it would be concomitant.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir de tsam gyis nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba sems pa'i bya bas ci bya /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa nyid med pa'i phyir de tsam gyis nyes pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba sems pa'i bya bas ci bya /
translated: But if it is not like that, then since there would be no distinctness, it would be faulty to that extent. So what would be the point of the activity of conceiving concomitance?

original: de'i phyir chos can ni rang gi sgrub byed du ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can ni rang gi sgrub byed du ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the subject is not established as its own proof.

original: gal te mar me la sogs pa rang gi sgrub par byed pa grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mar me la sogs pa rang gi sgrub par byed pa grub pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that a lamp and so on are established as their own proof?

original: grub pa ni bden te /
analyzed: grub pa ni bden te /
translated: It is true that it is established,

original: lkog tu ma gyur pas sgrub pa ni ma yin pa des na mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pas sgrub pa ni ma yin pa des na mi mthun pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: but not by a proof that is not hidden. Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs position is stated.

original: mar me mthong ba na ni rang gi ngo bo la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: mar me mthong ba na ni rang gi ngo bo la rtsod pa med do //
translated: When a lamp is seen, there is no dispute about its nature.

original: 'dir ni sgra mthong yang mi rtag pa nyid la rtsod pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni sgra mthong yang mi rtag pa nyid la rtsod pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: But here, even though sound is seen, there is a dispute about its impermanence.

original: gal te rtsod pa med na ni sgra nyid bzhin du mngon sum du grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //üîΩdngos po kun la chos dang ni //
analyzed: gal te rtsod pa med na ni sgra nyid bzhin du mngon sum du grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro // dngos po kun la chos dang ni //
translated: If there were no dispute, then impermanence would be established by perception, just like sound itself.üîΩBecause there is no distinction between

original: chos can rnam dbye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos can rnam dbye med pa'i phyir //
translated: the property and the possessor of the property in regard to all things,

original: kun la nyes mtshungs she na min //
analyzed: kun la nyes mtshungs she na min //
translated: the fault would apply to everything.

original: kun rdzob tu khyad yod phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu khyad yod phyir ro //
translated: But this is not so, because there is a difference in the conventional.

original: gal te byas pa nyid dang sgra nyid kyang mar me bzhin du mngon sum du 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid dang sgra nyid kyang mar me bzhin du mngon sum du 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: If being produced and being sound are not established by perception, like a lamp,

original: ci ste chos kyi dbye ba rtag pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste chos kyi dbye ba rtag pas bsgrub bya dang sgrub par byed pa'i dngos po la tha dad pa yin na /
translated: then if the distinction of the property is established by a permanent entity, the object to be established and the means of establishment are different.

original: de ni mar me la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni mar me la yang mtshungs te /
translated: But that is the same for a lamp.

original: de la yang mar me'i rang bzhin zhes rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang mar me'i rang bzhin zhes rtogs pa tha dad pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is a difference in the understanding of the nature of the lamp,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: no, because

original: kun rdzob tu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the difference is conventional.

original: mar me'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba 'dir yang ji ltar tha dad par brtags pa de bzhin du bsgrub bya sgrub bye du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba 'dir yang ji ltar tha dad par brtags pa de bzhin du bsgrub bya sgrub bye du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And in this case, ‚Äúthe nature of the lamp,‚Äù the probandum and the proof are not the same as the difference imagined.

original: byed pa dang bcas pa dang byed pa med pa'i gnas skad la ni mar me'i tha snyad yin la rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam la yin no //
analyzed: byed pa dang bcas pa dang byed pa med pa'i gnas skad la ni mar me'i tha snyad yin la rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin tsam la yin no //
translated: The convention ‚Äúlamp‚Äù is in the case of something that has activity, and ‚Äúnature‚Äù is in the case of mere nature.

original: de la rang bzhin ni don bya ba byed pa las yin te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni don bya ba byed pa las yin te /
translated: And nature is from the performance of an object‚Äôs function,

original: rang bzhin gyis don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nature is the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: mer ma ni chos can no //
analyzed: mer ma ni chos can no //
translated: The lamp is the subject.

original: byed pa med pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa med pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid yong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it does not have its own nature.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med pas byed pa med pa yin no zhes ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba med pas byed pa med pa yin no zhes ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not right to say that it is without activity because it does not perform the desired function,

original: ha jang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha jang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: de skad du brjod pas ni don 'ga' yang 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad du brjod pas ni don 'ga' yang 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But by saying that, nothing is established.

original: tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that it is understood as different,

original: de ni spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos pos kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos pos kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is established by the nature of universals and particulars.

original: de'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can gyi ngo bo ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the subject is not established,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: byas pa dang mi @210b rtag pa dang / sgra rnams ni ldog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: byas pa dang mi @210b rtag pa dang / sgra rnams ni ldog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Sound is impermanent because it is produced, and sound is different because it is produced.üîΩThus,üîΩThe nature of an object is one,

original: 'di ltar / don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la //üîΩtshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig / bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la // tshad ma rnams kyis brtag bya gang //
translated: and it is directly perceived.

original: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: ma mthong cha gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: What other part, not seen,üîΩis there to be examined by valid cognitions?

original: don gyi bdag nyid gcig po de ni mngon sum gyis mngon sum du byas pa de'i phyir 'di la brtag par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
analyzed: don gyi bdag nyid gcig po de ni mngon sum gyis mngon sum du byas pa de'i phyir 'di la brtag par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod /
translated: Since that one nature of the object is made directly perceptible by direct perception, what other part of it is there to be examined?

original: gal te chos can tsam mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te chos can tsam mngon sum gyis grub pa yin gyi /
translated: If you think that direct perception establishes only the subject,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not a dharma such as impermanence.

original: ma yin te mi rtag pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te mi rtag pa nyid dang lhan cig gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it is identical with impermanence.

original: mi rtag pa yid ces bya ba de las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa yid ces bya ba de las gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no impermanence apart from what is impermanent.

original: mi rtag gzhan nyid yin na sgra //üîΩchos can du ni ji ltar 'dzin //
analyzed: mi rtag gzhan nyid yin na sgra // chos can du ni ji ltar 'dzin //
translated: If impermanence were different,

original: dus gzhan khyab dang ci shos shes //üîΩbya ba gnyi g-yang mi 'thad //
analyzed: dus gzhan khyab dang ci shos shes // bya ba gnyi g-yang mi 'thad //
translated: how could one apprehend it as the characteristic of something impermanent?üîΩIf it were all-pervading, it would be permanent.

original: gal te dus gzhan khyab na ni //
analyzed: gal te dus gzhan khyab na ni //
translated: If it were not, the activity of the two would be untenable.

original: rtag pa nyid du yongs gzung bas //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du yongs gzung bas //
translated: If it were all-pervading, it would be permanent.üîΩIf it were not, it would be apprehended as impermanent.

original: tshad gzhan stong phrag yod na yang //
analyzed: tshad gzhan stong phrag yod na yang //
translated: Even if there were thousands of other valid cognitions,

original: de las mi rtag nyid 'dzin min ;
analyzed: de las mi rtag nyid 'dzin min ;
translated: they would not apprehend impermanence.

original: / ji ltar tshad ma gzhan dag las //
analyzed: / ji ltar tshad ma gzhan dag las //
translated: Just as the understanding from other valid cognitions

original: mthong sum gyis ni rtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: mthong sum gyis ni rtogs pa nyid //
translated: is realized by direct perception,

original: sel gyur mngon sum tshad ma gzhan //
analyzed: sel gyur mngon sum tshad ma gzhan //
translated: the other valid cognitions that are eliminations

original: thams cad kyi ni rtsa ba yin //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni rtsa ba yin //
translated: are the root of all.

original: sngom dang chos mtshungs pa skyed par byed pa za ba ni rgyal po'i bu dag kho na yin gyi //
analyzed: sngom dang chos mtshungs pa skyed par byed pa za ba ni rgyal po'i bu dag kho na yin gyi //
translated: Only the sons of the king generate the same dharma and cause the eater.

original: tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the cognition that is a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma thams cad kyi gtso bo ni mngon sum yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad kyi gtso bo ni mngon sum yin na /
translated: And if direct perception is the chief of all valid cognitions,

original: di ci na ga po chen po'i 'di mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis za ba 'am /üîΩ'on te mngon sum gyis rtag pa nyid dam /
analyzed: di ci na ga po chen po'i 'di mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis za ba 'am / 'on te mngon sum gyis rtag pa nyid dam /
translated: then why is this great earth eaten by the sky-goers?

original: mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rtag pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, is permanence or impermanence not perceived by direct perception?

original: des ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo tsam gcod pa yin no //
translated: For it is the mere intrinsic nature of all things that is ascertained by it.

original: rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ni phyis kyi tshad ma la brten pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ni phyis kyi tshad ma la brten pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But permanence or impermanence is ascertained by a subsequent valid cognition.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa ma yin nam ci ltar ma bzung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rang gi ngo bor gyur pa ma yin nam ci ltar ma bzung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur //
translated: But isn‚Äôt impermanence the intrinsic nature? How can it be said that it is not apprehended?

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa 'di ni dus kyis cha rgya cher khyab pa nyid yin la mi rtag pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa 'di ni dus kyis cha rgya cher khyab pa nyid yin la mi rtag pa ni de las bzlog pa nyid do //
translated: Because this permanence is the extensive pervasion of time, and impermanence is the opposite of that.

original: dngos po khyab par gzung na ni //
analyzed: dngos po khyab par gzung na ni //
translated: If an entity is apprehended as pervaded,

original: de lta khyab par gzung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta khyab par gzung bar 'gyur //
translated: then it is apprehended as pervaded.

original: gal te de ni ma bzung na //
analyzed: gal te de ni ma bzung na //
translated: If it is not apprehended,

original: mi rtag par ni rig par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag par ni rig par 'gyur //
translated: it is known as impermanent.

original: gang gi tshe nyid dngos po rnams dus gzhan khyab par ma rtogs pa nyid kyi chos mi rtag par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyid dngos po rnams dus gzhan khyab par ma rtogs pa nyid kyi chos mi rtag par gsal ba yin no //
translated: When the thing itself is not apprehended as pervading another time, then impermanence is clearly manifest.

original: nyid rtogs pa yi gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩmi rtag pa @211a * //
analyzed: nyid rtogs pa yi gyi mi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na / mi rtag pa @211a * //
translated: But impermanence is not known when the thing itself is known.üîΩWhat is this so-called impermanence?

original: zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / de nyid kyi khyad par du 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan ni /üîΩde de nyid kyi tshe yod dam 'on te phyis yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / de nyid kyi khyad par du 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan ni / de de nyid kyi tshe yod dam 'on te phyis yin /
translated: Is it a different attribute that is the distinction of that very thing?üîΩIs it present at that very time or later?

original: de nyid kyi tshe yod ce na //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe yod ce na //
translated: If it is present at that very time,

original: ci ste mngon sum gyis ma rtogs //
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum gyis ma rtogs //
translated: why is it not apprehended by direct perception?

original: ma rtogs na ci ltar de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: ma rtogs na ci ltar de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin /
translated: If it is not apprehended, how can it be of the nature of that?

original: de'i bdag nyid ni bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes 'brel pa nyid du rtogs na gdon mi za bar de de ltar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ni bdag nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhes 'brel pa nyid du rtogs na gdon mi za bar de de ltar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is related to that, it must be known as of the nature of that.

original: de dang 'brel par ma rtogs na ni /
analyzed: de dang 'brel par ma rtogs na ni /
translated: But if it is not known as related to that,

original: de ltar 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that it is of the nature of that.

original: phyis de dang 'brel par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: phyis de dang 'brel par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is known as related to that later,üîΩthen it is not of the nature of that.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gang //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur gang //
translated: What is the definition of an object?

original: mngon sum gyis ni bcad med de //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni bcad med de //
translated: It is not a direct perception,üîΩbecause it is not apprehended at that time.

original: ji ltar de tshe yod ces bya //
analyzed: ji ltar de tshe yod ces bya //
translated: How can it be said to exist?

original: gzhan du med pa rtogs med 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du med pa rtogs med 'gyur //
translated: It is not apprehended as non-existent elsewhere.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ba las /
translated: The definition of an object is that which is apprehended by direct perception.

original: mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid do zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid do zhes rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Non-apprehension is just that.

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other way to prove non-existence.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
translated: For those who speak of valid cognition,

original: don gyis bzlog pa nyid las so //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: don gyis bzlog pa nyid las so // zhes bshad do //
translated: it is the opposite of the object.

original: 'on te de ni 'khrul pa yin te des na ma dmigs kyang mi skyon no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'khrul pa yin te des na ma dmigs kyang mi skyon no zhe na /
translated: But if it is mistaken, then even if it does not apprehend, there is no fault.

original: gal te chos can 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gal te chos can 'dzin pa ni //
translated: If the apprehension of the subject

original: kun la 'khrul pa 'jug 'gyur na //
analyzed: kun la 'khrul pa 'jug 'gyur na //
translated: is mistaken in all cases,

original: chos can tshad ma med pas na //
analyzed: chos can tshad ma med pas na //
translated: then the subject is not a valid cognition,

original: rjes dpag tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rjes dpag tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: so how can inference be a valid cognition?

original: chos can dang ni 'brel min pa'i ;
analyzed: chos can dang ni 'brel min pa'i ;
translated: A reason that is unrelated

original: / gtan tshigs grub la ci ltar ston //
analyzed: / gtan tshigs grub la ci ltar ston //
translated: to the subject is not established.

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / gang tshe tshad ma ma yin pa //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / gang tshe tshad ma ma yin pa //
translated: If perception and inference are not valid cognitions,

original: de tshe gzhal bya ma grub par //
analyzed: de tshe gzhal bya ma grub par //
translated: then the objects of knowledge are not established.

original: 'gyur phyir rnam par rig pa tsam //
analyzed: 'gyur phyir rnam par rig pa tsam //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is mere representation.

original: gang gis byung dang 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: gang gis byung dang 'byung ba yi //
translated: The nature of what has arisen and what will arise

original: rang bzhin mngon sum gyis gzung min //
analyzed: rang bzhin mngon sum gyis gzung min //
translated: is not apprehended by perception.üîΩIf the reason and the subject

original: de tshe gtan tshigs chos can dang ; /'brel pa mngon sum gyis grub na //
analyzed: de tshe gtan tshigs chos can dang ; /'brel pa mngon sum gyis grub na //
translated: are established by perception,

original: byung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yis //
analyzed: byung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yis //
translated: then things that have arisen and will arise

original: dngos po rjes dpag las grub pas //
analyzed: dngos po rjes dpag las grub pas //
translated: are established by inference.üîΩThen the other perception

original: de tshe mngon sum cig shos dag / grub pa rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur //üîΩgal te byung dang 'byung ba yi //
analyzed: de tshe mngon sum cig shos dag / grub pa rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur // gal te byung dang 'byung ba yi //
translated: would be established along with its cause.üîΩIf you assert that the thing

original: dngos po gcig pu 'dod na ni //üîΩde tshe mngon sum tshad ma yis //
analyzed: dngos po gcig pu 'dod na ni // de tshe mngon sum tshad ma yis //
translated: that has arisen and will arise is one,üîΩthen because it is established

original: grub phyir rjes dpag don med do //
analyzed: grub phyir rjes dpag don med do //
translated: by the valid knowledge of perception, inference is meaningless.

original: 'khrul pa yin na ni thams cad 'jig pa nyams par 'gyur bas 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin na ni thams cad 'jig pa nyams par 'gyur bas 'gar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is mistaken, then all would be destroyed and corrupted, so it would never be so.

original: des na rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid ni mngon sum gyis 'grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, permanence or impermanence is established by perception itself.

original: 'on te chos yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te chos yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyis grub pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is a property, it is not established by perception.

original: mngon sum @211b gyis ni chos can tsam grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum @211b gyis ni chos can tsam grub pa yin te /
translated: For perception establishes only the subject.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, there would be no inference,

original: chos can thams cad mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos can thams cad mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because all subjects would be established by perception.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / chos ni mngon sum gyis grub na //üîΩchos can rab tu grub pa nyid //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / 'di ltar / chos ni mngon sum gyis grub na // chos can rab tu grub pa nyid //
translated: That is not so.üîΩFor thus:üîΩIf the property is established by perception,

original: mngon sum yang ni yan 'gar ba'i ;
analyzed: mngon sum yang ni yan 'gar ba'i ;
translated: then the subject is established.

original: / chos can sgrub par byed pa min //
analyzed: / chos can sgrub par byed pa min //
translated: But perception does not establishüîΩthe subject separately from the property.

original: gang du yang chos med par chos can grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang du yang chos med par chos can grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A subject is not established without a property,

original: gdon mi za bar sgra nyid dam dngos po nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sgra nyid dam dngos po nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would necessarily apprehend sound itself or entity itself.

original: des na ji ltar sgra nyid la sogs par yang ste /
analyzed: des na ji ltar sgra nyid la sogs par yang ste /
translated: Therefore, just as sound itself, etc.,

original: de la khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de la khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: there is no difference in that.

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i chos 'ga' zhig ma mthong mod /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i chos 'ga' zhig ma mthong mod /
translated: If you say that you do not see any property of error,

original: 'di la skyon ci yod /
analyzed: 'di la skyon ci yod /
translated: what is the problem with that?

original: dper na tho yor dang skyes bu dag bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na tho yor dang skyes bu dag bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, like a scarecrow and a man.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: mi dang tho yor med par ni //
analyzed: mi dang tho yor med par ni //
translated: For, without a man and a scarecrow,

original: reng reng po tsam lta bar nus //
analyzed: reng reng po tsam lta bar nus //
translated: one can see a mere collection of parts.

original: khyab dang cig shos med par ni //
analyzed: khyab dang cig shos med par ni //
translated: Here, in the absence of the pervaded and the pervader,

original: 'dir ni don gyi blo yod min //
analyzed: 'dir ni don gyi blo yod min //
translated: there is no cognition of the object.

original: khyab dang cig shos dang bral ba ni bzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab dang cig shos dang bral ba ni bzung bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: For, without the pervaded and the pervader, one cannot apprehend the object.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de yin na /
translated: If that is its nature,

original: gal te ma bzung na ni de ma bzung ba nyid pas de ni ma bzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma bzung na ni de ma bzung ba nyid pas de ni ma bzung ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: if it is not apprehended, then it is not apprehended, because it is not apprehended.

original: gal te ring por ma bzung yang mthong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ring por ma bzung yang mthong ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But, if it is not apprehended as long, is it not seen?

original: ma yin te der ni yan lag nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te der ni yan lag nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there the parts are seen.

original: de ni ring po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni ring po nyid ma yin no //
translated: That is not length.

original: ring po nyid de ni yan lag can yin la /
analyzed: ring po nyid de ni yan lag can yin la /
translated: Length is the possessor of the parts.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: And that is to be understood by inference.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / gcig g-yo ba na thams cad ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig g-yo ba na thams cad ni //
translated: if one moves, all move,

original: g-yo phyir de ni gcig go zhes //
analyzed: g-yo phyir de ni gcig go zhes //
translated: therefore it is one.

original: rtogs 'gyur des na gcig pa nyid //
analyzed: rtogs 'gyur des na gcig pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, it is one.

original: 'di ni rjes dpag las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes dpag las yin no //
translated: This is by inference.

original: yan lag gcig ma mthong ba na yan lag gi tshogs thams cad rags par dmigs pa de gzhan dang gcig go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: yan lag gcig ma mthong ba na yan lag gi tshogs thams cad rags par dmigs pa de gzhan dang gcig go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: When one part is not seen, the entire collection of parts is perceived as gross. That is one with the other.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not even inference.

original: phan tshun 'brel pa nyid rjes su dpag par 'gyur gyi gcig nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa nyid rjes su dpag par 'gyur gyi gcig nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Mutual connection would be inferred, not oneness.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'i yul yang ma yin te /
translated: That is not even the object of inference.

original: mngon sum ma zhugs na tshad ma gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma zhugs na tshad ma gzhan gyi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: When direct perception does not engage, it becomes the object of another valid cognition.

original: de nyid ni mthong ba'ang yin la ma mthong ba yang yin na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de nyid ni mthong ba'ang yin la ma mthong ba yang yin na mi 'thad do //
translated: That very thing is both seen and unseen, but that is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir dus khyab pa 'am mi khyab pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus khyab pa 'am mi khyab pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, whether it pervades time or does not pervade,

original: de ni mngon sum gyis bzung ba yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyis bzung ba yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni ma yin no //
translated: it is apprehended by direct perception, not the object of inference.

original: de la gal te 'di rang bzhin des mngon sum gyi yul ma yin na de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gal te 'di rang bzhin des mngon sum gyi yul ma yin na de'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: If it is not the object of direct perception by virtue of that nature, it is not its nature.

original: @212a * // mngon sum gyis sngon po nyid du yul du byas pa na ni ser po la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @212a * // mngon sum gyis sngon po nyid du yul du byas pa na ni ser po la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: When direct perception takes blue as its object, it is not yellow, etc.

original: dus gzhan khyab par ma bzung bar der ni de lta bu nyid yin par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan khyab par ma bzung bar der ni de lta bu nyid yin par bsam par bya ste /
translated: When it is not apprehended as pervading another time, it should be considered to be just that.

original: gzhan du na dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag bsdoms pas de nyid kyi tshe thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du na dus kyi cha'i tshogs mtha' dag bsdoms pas de nyid kyi tshe thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, since all the collections of parts of time are combined at that time, all would be completely perfect.

original: de nyid kyi tshe dus thams cad kyi bya ba'i don bya ba byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe dus thams cad kyi bya ba'i don bya ba byed par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that at that time, all times would perform the function of the object to be performed.

original: byung ba dang 'byung ba'i dus kyi cha ma bzung bas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: byung ba dang 'byung ba'i dus kyi cha ma bzung bas na de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not so because the time of occurrence and the time of arising are not apprehended,

original: de ma bzung na de khyab pa nyid du yang mi 'dzin pa nyid pas dus de tsam dang 'brel par bzung bas shes par bya ba mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma bzung na de khyab pa nyid du yang mi 'dzin pa nyid pas dus de tsam dang 'brel par bzung bas shes par bya ba mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if that is not apprehended, it is not apprehended as pervading. Therefore, it is not understood by apprehending it as connected with just that time.

original: de lta yin na glog la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid do /üîΩ// / bam po dgu pa /
analyzed: de lta yin na glog la sogs pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid do / // / bam po dgu pa /
translated: If that were so, it would be impermanent, like lightning and so on.

original: gal te glog la sogs pa ni zhig pas na mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te glog la sogs pa ni zhig pas na mi rtag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that lightning and so on are impermanent because they disintegrate,

original: de'i dus dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dus dang 'brel pa tsam gyis ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that they do not disintegrate merely through their connection with time,üîΩthen how could they disintegrate without something that causes their disintegration?

original: 'o na 'jig par byed pa 'ga' yang med par ci ltar 'jig / sprin gyis bkab pa nyid kyis 'jig go zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'jig par byed pa 'ga' yang med par ci ltar 'jig / sprin gyis bkab pa nyid kyis 'jig go zhe na /
translated: If you say that they disintegrate because they are obscured by clouds,

original: 'di la yang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pas gnod par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'di la yang rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pas gnod par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: then why do you not accept that they are harmed by things that are both similar and dissimilar to them?

original: de'i phyir glog kyang dus phyis mi dmigs pa nyid 'jig pa yin la de ni don thams cad la yang yod pas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir glog kyang dus phyis mi dmigs pa nyid 'jig pa yin la de ni don thams cad la yang yod pas rtag pa nyid du 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, lightning is not observed later because it disintegrates, and since that is the case for all things, it is not possible to apprehend them as permanent.

original: gal te bum pa la sogs pa dus kyis kyang 'dzin pas ni ci ltar mi 'dzin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa la sogs pa dus kyis kyang 'dzin pas ni ci ltar mi 'dzin par brjod ce na /
translated: If you say that time also apprehends a pot and so on, why do you not say that it apprehends them as impermanent?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not apprehend them.

original: sngar gyi dus kyang bzung ba med na de'i dus na yod pa'i dngos po lta ci smos /
analyzed: sngar gyi dus kyang bzung ba med na de'i dus na yod pa'i dngos po lta ci smos /
translated: If the past is not apprehended, how much less could the entity that existed at that time!

original: yud tsam dang nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i dus ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po las tha dad par tshad mas grub pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yud tsam dang nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa'i dus ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po las tha dad par tshad mas grub pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The time of a moment, a day, a month, etc., is not established by any valid cognition as different from the entity, such as form.

original: nyi ma dang por zla ba rtogs pa med la /
analyzed: nyi ma dang por zla ba rtogs pa med la /
translated: The moon is not apprehended on the first day.

original: nyi ma gnyis par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi ma gnyis par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it on the second day.

original: de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe snga ma dang phyi ma mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time the former and the latter are not apprehended.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa'i dus ni dran pas rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa'i dus ni dran pas rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the time of the sun, etc., is apprehended by memory,

original: ma yin te dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te dran pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because memory is not a valid cognition.

original: dran pa ni snga na med pa'i don grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa ni snga na med pa'i don grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Memory does not establish a meaning that did not exist before.

original: dran pa mngon sum sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: dran pa mngon sum sngon 'gro can //
translated: Memory is preceded by direct perception.

original: mngon sum min don spyod yul min //üîΩmngon sum gyis ni zla ba la //
analyzed: mngon sum min don spyod yul min // mngon sum gyis ni zla ba la //
translated: It does not have as its domain a meaning that is not direct perception.üîΩDirect perception does not apprehend

original: sogs pa'i dus ni 'dzin ma yin //üîΩgal te de ni bsags pa yi //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dus ni 'dzin ma yin // gal te de ni bsags pa yi //
translated: the time of the sun, etc.üîΩIf you say that it is known and expressed

original: rang bzhin du shes brjod na ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin du shes brjod na ni //
translated: as having the nature of an accumulation,

original: bsags pa 'dzin par byed pa @212b yi ;
analyzed: bsags pa 'dzin par byed pa @212b yi ;
translated: The accumulation is held.üîΩ

original: / tshad ma med ces bsgrubs zin to //üîΩgal te mngon sum du ma yis //
analyzed: / tshad ma med ces bsgrubs zin to // gal te mngon sum du ma yis //
translated: It has been proven that there is no valid cognitionüîΩThat can apprehend the accumulated.üîΩIf you assert that the object is not established

original: grub phyir ma grub min 'dod na //
analyzed: grub phyir ma grub min 'dod na //
translated: Because it is not established by direct perception,

original: 'ga' yis ci ltar bsgrub par nus //
analyzed: 'ga' yis ci ltar bsgrub par nus //
translated: How can it be established by anything?üîΩIt has already been explained

original: dran pa tshad ma nyid min pa //üîΩsngar nyid du ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: dran pa tshad ma nyid min pa // sngar nyid du ni bstan pa yin //
translated: That memory is not a valid cognition.

original: dran pa las 'byung kun rdzob pa //
analyzed: dran pa las 'byung kun rdzob pa //
translated: What arises from memory is conventional,

original: yin gyi de ni don dam min //üîΩdus ni kun rdzob nyid kyis na //
analyzed: yin gyi de ni don dam min // dus ni kun rdzob nyid kyis na //
translated: But it is not ultimate.üîΩTime is conventional,

original: des khyab gsal bar kun rdzob pa //
analyzed: des khyab gsal bar kun rdzob pa //
translated: And what is pervaded by that is conventional.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid ni //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, impermanence

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ces rtogs //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid ces rtogs //
translated: Is understood to be the nature of things.

original: gal te 'di ni rang bzhin nyid //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni rang bzhin nyid //
translated: If this is the nature of things,

original: kun rdzob tha dad ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun rdzob tha dad ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can the conventional be different?

original: med pa yi ni kun rdzob ni //
analyzed: med pa yi ni kun rdzob ni //
translated: A non-existent conventional

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed nyid ma yin //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed nyid ma yin //
translated: Is not the object of affirmation.

original: 'brel pa yod pa nyid las ni //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa nyid las ni //
translated: From the existence of a relation,

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag tu gnas //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag tu gnas //
translated: The object of affirmation and the means of affirmation remain.

original: 'brel pa yod pa dang 'bral ba //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod pa dang 'bral ba //
translated: Without the existence of a relation,

original: bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag ma yin //
analyzed: bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag ma yin //
translated: There is no object of affirmation and no means of affirmation.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdu ma'i gcig las log pa ni //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / du ma'i gcig las log pa ni //
translated: Here, someone might say,üîΩThe opposite of the many and the one

original: rang bzhin gcig gis rtogs pa yis //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig gis rtogs pa yis //
translated: Is realized by a single nature.

original: yul du byed 'gyur de bas na //
analyzed: yul du byed 'gyur de bas na //
translated: Therefore, the object is taken to be

original: chos dang chos can rnam par gnas //
analyzed: chos dang chos can rnam par gnas //
translated: The property and the property possessor.üîΩThe similarity of all thingsüîΩAnd the opposite of the other object

original: dngos po kun gyi rigs mthun dang // cig shos don las log pa dang // mngon sum rtogs par gzung ba ste //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rigs mthun dang // cig shos don las log pa dang // mngon sum rtogs par gzung ba ste //
translated: Is apprehended by direct perception.

original: rjes 'gro rtogs pa tsam las yin //üîΩgal te dbang po'i byed pa las //
analyzed: rjes 'gro rtogs pa tsam las yin // gal te dbang po'i byed pa las //
translated: It is merely the realization of the subsequent.

original: snga ma phyi mar rtogs bcas pa //
analyzed: snga ma phyi mar rtogs bcas pa //
translated: If the prior is realized by the activity of the sense faculties,

original: mngon sum zhe na mngon sum min //
analyzed: mngon sum zhe na mngon sum min //
translated: The subsequent is not direct perception.

original: lhan cig 'byung yang rjes 'gro med ;
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung yang rjes 'gro med ;
translated: Even if they arise together, there is no subsequent.

original: / gang gis dang po gcig nyid mthong //
analyzed: / gang gis dang po gcig nyid mthong //
translated: By what is the first one seen?

original: de ni de la rjes 'gro bar //üîΩsnang min gsal ba thams cad ni //
analyzed: de ni de la rjes 'gro bar // snang min gsal ba thams cad ni //
translated: That is the subsequent.üîΩIf it is not seen, it follows that all clarity

original: snang ba nyid du thal 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: snang ba nyid du thal 'gyur phyir //
translated: Is seen.

original: thag ring nyid la sogs pa yis //üîΩgsal ba mi snang zhes gnas nas //
analyzed: thag ring nyid la sogs pa yis // gsal ba mi snang zhes gnas nas //
translated: Because of being far away and so on,üîΩIt is maintained that clarity is not seen.

original: gsal ba gzung ba med par spyi //
analyzed: gsal ba gzung ba med par spyi //
translated: Without apprehending clarity,

original: de khyab par ni 'dzin mi 'gyur//
analyzed: de khyab par ni 'dzin mi 'gyur//
translated: The universal cannot apprehend it.

original: sngar gsal ba gzung ba'i 'du byed las gsal ba gzhan la de ltar 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gsal ba gzung ba'i 'du byed las gsal ba gzhan la de ltar 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: But it is held that the other clarity is apprehended from the formative force that apprehends the former clarity.üîΩThis is not so,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: because:

original: 'di ltar / de dngos gzung bas bskyed pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de dngos gzung bas bskyed pa yis //
translated: The formative force generated by the apprehension of that

original: 'du byed dran pa'i rgyu mtshan yin //üîΩgsal ba 'dzin pa'i 'du byed las //
analyzed: 'du byed dran pa'i rgyu mtshan yin // gsal ba 'dzin pa'i 'du byed las //
translated: is the basis for the memory of the object.

original: don gzhan rig par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: don gzhan rig par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: How can there be a cognition of an object that is differentüîΩfrom the formative force that apprehends the clarity?

original: gsal ba 'dzin pas byas pa'i 'du byed ni de nyid la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi /üîΩsnga ma med pa'i don mthong ba 'am /
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin pas byas pa'i 'du byed ni de nyid la dran pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi / snga ma med pa'i don mthong ba 'am /
translated: The formative force that is produced by the apprehension of the clarity is the cause of the consciousness that remembers that clarity.üîΩIt is not the cause of seeing an object that did not exist previously,

original: sngar gyi don mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi don mthong ba'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: nor is it the cause of seeing a previous object.

original: ma mthong ba dran pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba dran pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the cause of remembering what was not seen.

original: spyi yang gsal ba dag las don gzhan yin pas na de ci ltar mthong ba de dran par yang @213a * //üîΩ'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: spyi yang gsal ba dag las don gzhan yin pas na de ci ltar mthong ba de dran par yang @213a * //üîΩ'gyur ba yin /
translated: Since the universal is different from the individual, how can it be that what is seen is also remembered?

original: sngar gyi don dran pa dang mthong ba las gsal ba dang cig shos kyi rnam pa can gyi gsal ba las tha dad pa gzhan ci mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi yin no zhes gang brjod pa /üîΩdon bya ba gcig pas byas pa 'am /
analyzed: sngar gyi don dran pa dang mthong ba las gsal ba dang cig shos kyi rnam pa can gyi gsal ba las tha dad pa gzhan ci mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan spyi yin no zhes gang brjod pa / don bya ba gcig pas byas pa 'am /
translated: The reason for the cognition of similarity is the universal, which is the cause of the cognition that has the aspect of similarity, and is different from the clear cognition that arises from remembering the object and seeing it, and from the clear cognition that arises from the other.

original: de'i rnam pa gcig byas pas mtshungs pa'i rtog par 'gyur gyi spyi'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gcig byas pas mtshungs pa'i rtog par 'gyur gyi spyi'i rang bzhin gyis byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of similarity arises from the performance of the same action or the performance of the same aspect, but not from the performance of the universal.

original: bram ze nyid la sogs par mtshungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bram ze nyid la sogs par mtshungs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the similarity of being a Brahmin.

original: gal te bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs med na ci ltar bsod nams dang sdig pa rnam par gnas she na /
analyzed: gal te bram ze nyid la sogs pa'i rigs med na ci ltar bsod nams dang sdig pa rnam par gnas she na /
translated: If the caste of a Brahmin does not exist, how can merit and sin exist?

original: rigs yod kyang ci ltar rigs ni gsad pa ma yin la chang 'thung ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs yod kyang ci ltar rigs ni gsad pa ma yin la chang 'thung ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Even if the caste exists, it is not killed and does not drink alcohol.

original: sdig pa dang bsod nams ni lung las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no lung de nyid ji ltar rtogs te /
analyzed: sdig pa dang bsod nams ni lung las gzhan pa'i tshad ma yod pa ma yin no lung de nyid ji ltar rtogs te /
translated: Sin and merit do not exist as valid cognitions other than scripture. How is that scripture understood?

original: rigs med par ni bram ze gsad par mi bya'o zhes bya bar rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs med par ni bram ze gsad par mi bya'o zhes bya bar rtogs par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot understand the statement ‚ÄúA brahmin should not be killed‚Äù to mean that one should not kill a non-brahmin.

original: gsal bar so sor rtogs par mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar so sor rtogs par mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is impossible to understand the words individually.

original: nye bar bstan pa'i ma mtshungs pa'i rnam pa las 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa'i ma mtshungs pa'i rnam pa las 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because the apprehension is from the presentation of the dissimilar form.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar bstan pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi nye bar bstan pa las yin gyi /
translated: The apprehension of the similar form is from the presentation of beginningless latent propensities.

original: 'dir de las gzhan pa'i tshad mas grub pa ni med do //üîΩgzhan yang / mtshungs pa'i rtogs pas gsal ba las //
analyzed: 'dir de las gzhan pa'i tshad mas grub pa ni med do // gzhan yang / mtshungs pa'i rtogs pas gsal ba las //
translated: Here, there is no establishment by any other valid cognition apart from that.üîΩMoreover:üîΩIs the body known to be different from the clear form

original: tha dad pa yi lus rig gam //
analyzed: tha dad pa yi lus rig gam //
translated: through the apprehension of the similar?

original: 'on te gzhan yin gzhan du ni //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan yin gzhan du ni //
translated: Or is it different from that?

original: rnam par dpyod ces shes par bya //üîΩkhyad par las ni tha dad pa'i //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod ces shes par bya // khyad par las ni tha dad pa'i //
translated: This should be understood through analysis.

original: bdag nyid rigs pas grub ldan min //
analyzed: bdag nyid rigs pas grub ldan min //
translated: The body does not have a nature established by reasoningüîΩthat is different from the clear form.

original: de las gzhan du rigs pa la //
analyzed: de las gzhan du rigs pa la //
translated: Apart from that,

original: gzhal bya yod pa nyid yod min //
analyzed: gzhal bya yod pa nyid yod min //
translated: the existence of the object of comprehension does not exist in reasoning.

original: gal te mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa dang 'brel pa yin na /
translated: If it is related to the aspect of a different cognition of the same object,

original: de de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir de las spyi ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: de de ltar ma grub pa'i phyir de las spyi ci ltar 'grub /
translated: then how can a universal be established from that, since it is not established in that way?

original: 'on te rtogs pa tsam yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa tsam yin na /
translated: But if it is merely a cognition,

original: de'i tshe spyi mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi mi 'grub po //
translated: then at that time a universal is not established.

original: rtogs pa tsam gyis ni don gyi khyad par 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam gyis ni don gyi khyad par 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: A particular object is not established by mere cognition.

original: gang gi rnam par rtog pa de nyid des 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi rnam par rtog pa de nyid des 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: That very conceptualization establishes it.

original: gzhan du ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: gal te spyi ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If a universal is both different and non-different,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is contradictory.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / tha dad las gzhan tha mi dad //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tha dad las gzhan tha mi dad //
translated: Difference is not different from non-difference.

original: de yang ci ltar tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang ci ltar tha dad 'gyur //
translated: And how could it be different?

original: tha dad snang ni tha dad de //
analyzed: tha dad snang ni tha dad de //
translated: If difference appears as different,

original: yang tha dad min ci ltar 'gyur //üîΩgal te tshul @213b 'gas tha dad par //
analyzed: yang tha dad min ci ltar 'gyur // gal te tshul @213b 'gas tha dad par //
translated: how could it be non-different?üîΩIf difference is asserted

original: 'dod na de nyid spyir 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dod na de nyid spyir 'gyur te //
translated: to be different by mode, that itself becomes a universal.

original: de ni tha dad med par ni //
analyzed: de ni tha dad med par ni //
