translated: That is not non-different.

original: mi 'gyur shin tu tha dad phyir //
analyzed: mi 'gyur shin tu tha dad phyir //
translated: Because they are utterly different, they are not one.

original: gzhan gyis tha dad med 'dod na //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha dad med 'dod na //
translated: If others assert that they are not different,üîΩThen at that time, it is not that they are different,

original: de tshe de ni tha dad dang // tha dad med min de nyid kyis //
analyzed: de tshe de ni tha dad dang // tha dad med min de nyid kyis //
translated: Nor that they are not different, by virtue of reality.

original: tha dad med na de yang ni //üîΩrnam pa stong 'gyur de las ni //
analyzed: tha dad med na de yang ni // rnam pa stong 'gyur de las ni //
translated: If they are not different,üîΩThen it would be impossible to remove

original: bton nas de zad rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bton nas de zad rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: The one from the other, and the one would not be exhausted.

original: gal te tha dad tha dad min //
analyzed: gal te tha dad tha dad min //
translated: If they are different,

original: mthong ba mthong ba min par thal //üîΩmthong dang mi mthong gcig go zhes //
analyzed: mthong ba mthong ba min par thal // mthong dang mi mthong gcig go zhes //
translated: Then it follows that what is seen is not seen.üîΩTo say that seeing and not seeing

original: bya ba shin tu ya mtshan che //
analyzed: bya ba shin tu ya mtshan che //
translated: Are the same is utterly absurd.

original: 'di ltar / dngos po yod dang med pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po yod dang med pa ni //
translated: Thus, existence and nonexistence

original: mthong dang ma mthong las grub phyir //üîΩgcig 'gyur shi ba 'ang de lta na //
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong las grub phyir // gcig 'gyur shi ba 'ang de lta na //
translated: Are established from seeing and not seeing.üîΩIf one thing were like this,

original: ma shi ba yi bdag tu 'gyur ;üîΩ/ de phyir spyi dang rtag pa yi //
analyzed: ma shi ba yi bdag tu 'gyur ; / de phyir spyi dang rtag pa yi //
translated: Then the living self would be the dead self.üîΩTherefore, you should see

original: rang bzhin nyid du blta bar gyis //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid du blta bar gyis //
translated: The nature of things as permanent and universal.

original: des na ldog pa'i dbye ba yis //
analyzed: des na ldog pa'i dbye ba yis //
translated: Thus, by the division of the negation,

original: chos dang chos can tha dad nyid //
analyzed: chos dang chos can tha dad nyid //
translated: The property and the basis of the property are different.

original: gal te de med de nyid du //
analyzed: gal te de med de nyid du //
translated: If they are not different,

original: dam bca'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid //
analyzed: dam bca'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid //
translated: Then the object of the thesis is only one part.

original: don dam par ni rnam dpyad na //
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam dpyad na //
translated: But in reality, when one examines,

original: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ma grub phyir //
translated: such a universal is not established.üîΩTherefore, the negation of identity and difference

original: kun rdzob pa yi dngos rnams la //üîΩde nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa yi dngos rnams la // de nyid gzhan nyid 'gog par 'gyur //
translated: applies to conventional things.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi ni gsal ba las tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i spyi ni gsal ba las tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: A universal that exists conventionally is different from the particulars,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is understood through concomitance and reverse concomitance.

original: de yang kha dog la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de yang kha dog la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it has the nature of color, etc.

original: rtogs pa med de /
analyzed: rtogs pa med de /
translated: It is not understood.

original: gnyi ga mthong ba yang gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma rtogs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga mthong ba yang gsal ba'i rnam pa gnyis las tha dad pa'i rnam pa gzhan ma rtogs so //
translated: When both are seen, the form of the two particulars is not understood as a different form.

original: der ni gsal ba gnyis kho na zhig snang ngo //
analyzed: der ni gsal ba gnyis kho na zhig snang ngo //
translated: There, only two particulars appear.

original: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i phyir snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i phyir snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it appears because of having a similar form,

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: snang ba rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu smras pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba rjes su dpag pas bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu smras pa yin no //
translated: To say that the appearance is established by inference is a great statement.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba ci rjes su dpag pas sgrub bam /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba ci rjes su dpag pas sgrub bam /
translated: Is the appearance of a wall, etc. established by inference?

original: gal te sngon byung ba'i dran pa brjed nas de'i tshe de dran par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa brjod pa 'am 'bad pa gzhan byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te sngon byung ba'i dran pa brjed nas de'i tshe de dran par bya ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa brjod pa 'am 'bad pa gzhan byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one forgets the memory of what occurred previously, then at that time one would make an effort to remember it by stating an inference or by some other means.

original: snang bzhin pa'i dus nyid na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i dus nyid na ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not at the time when it is appearing.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang bzhin pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba 'am rtsig pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa snang bzhin pa ni rtsig pa la sogs pa snang ba 'am rtsig pa la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas sgrub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is appearing, such as a wall, is not established by the appearance of a wall or by the inference of a wall.

original: 'jig rten na gang gi phyir rtsig pa'i rnam pa snang ba de'i phyir rtsig pa 'am rtsig par snang ba yod pa yin no zhes rtogs pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na gang gi phyir rtsig pa'i rnam pa snang ba de'i phyir rtsig pa 'am rtsig par snang ba yod pa yin no zhes rtogs pa ni med kyi /
translated: In the world, one does not understand that because the aspect of a wall appears, therefore a wall or the appearance of a wall exists.

original: 'on kyang gang gi phyir gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyis dben par rang gi ngo bo nyid du mthong ba de'i phyir @214a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi phyir gzhan gyis rang bzhin gyis dben par rang gi ngo bo nyid du mthong ba de'i phyir @214a * //
translated: However, because one sees the nature of a wall as empty of intrinsic reality,

original: yod pa 'am snang ba yin no zhes so //
analyzed: yod pa 'am snang ba yin no zhes so //
translated: therefore it exists or appears.

original: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i spyi ni snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i spyi ni snang ba yin no //
translated: A universal that is empty of the nature of manifestation is an appearance.

original: spyi ni snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni snang ba ma yin no //
translated: A universal is not an appearance.

original: spyi ni mdog dbyibs gzhan dang ldan par mtshon pa med do //
analyzed: spyi ni mdog dbyibs gzhan dang ldan par mtshon pa med do //
translated: But the universal is not manifested as having a different color or shape.

original: mdog dbyibs las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid spyi'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mdog dbyibs las phyi rol du gyur pa nyid spyi'i rang bzhin yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is the nature of being external to color and shape,

original: 'o na spyi med par 'gyur te mdog dbyibs phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na spyi med par 'gyur te mdog dbyibs phyi rol du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be no universal, because there is no external to color and shape.

original: khyab pa nyid de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyab pa nyid de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that pervasion is its own nature,

original: 'o na mdog dbyibs kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na mdog dbyibs kyis mtshungs pa ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni mi mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: then what is not similar to color and shape is not similar.

original: khyab pas ni mdog dang dbyibs dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: khyab pas ni mdog dang dbyibs dang ldan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But pervasion is not endowed with color and shape.

original: mdog dbyibs nyid khyab pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mdog dbyibs nyid khyab pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that color and shape themselves are the pervasion,

original: gal te khyab pa yin na khyab pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te khyab pa yin na khyab pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then if they are the pervasion, they would be recognized as the pervasion.

original: dus gzhan du rtogs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dus gzhan du rtogs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are recognized at a different time,

original: ma yin te gsal ba yod pa dang med pa dag las khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te gsal ba yod pa dang med pa dag las khyad par med pa'i phyir te /
translated: that is not so, because there is no difference between the presence and absence of manifestation.

original: sngon mi gsal ba zhig kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon mi gsal ba zhig kyang de kho na ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what was previously unmanifest is recognized in just that way.

original: sngon gyi ma zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi ma zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the non-destruction of the prior state,

original: der dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is perceived.

original: ji ltar zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhig ce na /
translated: How is it destroyed?

original: gal te ma zhig na de 'am gzhan gyis snga mar ji ltar ma dmigs /
analyzed: gal te ma zhig na de 'am gzhan gyis snga mar ji ltar ma dmigs /
translated: If it is not destroyed, then how is it that it is not perceived in the prior state, either by itself or by another?

original: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not pervade.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni dmigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni dmigs pa kho na ste /
translated: Its nature is only that which is perceived,

original: yul khyab pa tsam nyid ma gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: yul khyab pa tsam nyid ma gtogs pa yin te /
translated: because it is merely the pervasion of the object,

original: bskal pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: bskal pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: because it is separated.

original: bskal zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig mi snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bskal zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig mi snang ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: What is this so-called separation? It is the non-appearance of the nature.

original: ji ltar snang ba mi snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba mi snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How can that which appears become the non-appearance of the nature?

original: yul gzhan du mthong ba nyid 'das pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul gzhan du mthong ba nyid 'das pa yin gyi /
translated: It is just the seeing of the object in another place that is past,

original: dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not the entity.

original: snang ba'i bdag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ma yin no zhes 'di ni gtan la phab zin to //
translated: It has been determined that the entity does not exist apart from the appearance of the nature.

original: gzhan yang yul gzhan du mthong ba zhig na khyab pa nyid zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang yul gzhan du mthong ba zhig na khyab pa nyid zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if it is the seeing of the object in another place, then the pervasion itself is destroyed.

original: de lta yin dang spyi mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang spyi mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, the universal would be impermanent.

original: de ltar gyur na yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gyur te gsal ba las tha dad pa'i mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa tsam nyid yin pas ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes bya bar gyur te gsal ba las tha dad pa'i mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa tsam nyid yin pas ni /
translated: Even if that were so, the universal would not be the nature of the manifestation, because it is merely the cognition of similarity that is different from the manifestation.

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a thing.

original: 'o na rtogs pa yin mod /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa yin mod /
translated: Well then, it is a cognition,

original: 'di dag mtshungs so zhes bya ba ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag mtshungs so zhes bya ba ci ltar zhe na /
translated: but how is it the same as those?

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang / don bya bas byas pa'i mtshungs pa'i phyir de ltar mtshungs pas skyon med do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang / don bya bas byas pa'i mtshungs pa'i phyir de ltar mtshungs pas skyon med do //
translated: Because of the similarity of color, shape, and function, it is the same in that way, so there is no fault.

original: yul 'khor dang mkhar la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul 'khor dang mkhar la sogs pa'i mtshungs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the similarity of a country, a fort, and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'di @214b skad ces /üîΩ'di ltar / gal te mdog sogs gsal ba las //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di @214b skad ces / 'di ltar / gal te mdog sogs gsal ba las //
translated: Moreover, this is said:

original: gzhan ma yin par gnas na ni //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par gnas na ni //
translated: Thus, if the universal does not exist apart from the manifestation of color and so on,

original: gsal ba gzhan la rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: then the cognition of another manifestation would not occur.

original: des na tha dad rnam par gnas //
analyzed: des na tha dad rnam par gnas //
translated: Therefore, the difference would remain.

original: ldog pa dang ni 'jug pa dag / tha dad med ces 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: ldog pa dang ni 'jug pa dag / tha dad med ces 'thad ma yin //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the difference between the universal and the manifestation is not real.

original: des na chos dang chos can gyi //
analyzed: des na chos dang chos can gyi //
translated: Therefore, the distinction between the property and the property-possessor

original: dbye ba rtogs pas grub pa yin //
analyzed: dbye ba rtogs pas grub pa yin //
translated: Is established by the realization.

original: des na tha dad de nyid du //
analyzed: des na tha dad de nyid du //
translated: Therefore, that very difference

original: dbang po yis ni 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: dbang po yis ni 'dzin ma yin //
translated: Is not apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: gang phyir mngon sum gyis grub dang // mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
analyzed: gang phyir mngon sum gyis grub dang // mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
translated: Because it is established by perception and is preceded by perception,

original: gang la rjes su dpag pa ni //
analyzed: gang la rjes su dpag pa ni //
translated: Where inference

original: 'jug pa don dam nyid yin pa //
analyzed: 'jug pa don dam nyid yin pa //
translated: Engages, that is the ultimate itself.

original: de phyir sgrub byed de bzhin ni //
analyzed: de phyir sgrub byed de bzhin ni //
translated: Therefore, the probandum is just like that,

original: kun rdzob gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid //üîΩde nyid gzhan nyid tshad ldan par //
analyzed: kun rdzob gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid // de nyid gzhan nyid tshad ldan par //
translated: The essence of the conventional.üîΩThat very thing is not established as different

original: de nyid dus na de yod min //
analyzed: de nyid dus na de yod min //
translated: At the time of reality.

original: rtogs pa tsam las tha dad de //
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam las tha dad de //
translated: Apart from mere realization,

original: de nyid du na gsal ba'i dngos //
analyzed: de nyid du na gsal ba'i dngos //
translated: The manifest entity

original: nges na mngon sum las grub pa //
analyzed: nges na mngon sum las grub pa //
translated: Is ascertained as established by perception.

original: gsal ba nyid du rtogs par gyis //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du rtogs par gyis //
translated: Understand it as manifest.

original: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can //
translated: Preceded by perception,

original: rjes dpag las kyang gsal ba bsgrub //
analyzed: rjes dpag las kyang gsal ba bsgrub //
translated: Inference also establishes manifestation.

original: des na gal te spyi gzhan ni //
analyzed: des na gal te spyi gzhan ni //
translated: Therefore, if a universal is established as different,

original: grub na khyad par rig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: grub na khyad par rig mi 'gyur //
translated: The particular would not be cognized.

original: des na khyad par rdzogs med pas //
analyzed: des na khyad par rdzogs med pas //
translated: Therefore, since the particular is not complete,

original: khyad par la ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par la ni 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: But it does not engage the particulars.

original: 'di ltar gal te spyi rtogs na //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te spyi rtogs na //
translated: If it cognizes the universal,

original: de'i tshe khyad par snang ba snang ba med pas khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe khyad par snang ba snang ba med pas khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time, since the particulars do not appear, it does not engage the particulars.

original: ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la 'jug pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But there is no engagement of what is not cognized.

original: 'on te spyi 'dzin pa ni khyad par mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i spyir gang la spyi yod pa de la khyad par yod par 'gyur ro zhes khyad par la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi 'dzin pa ni khyad par mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de dang 'brel par 'dzin pa'i spyir gang la spyi yod pa de la khyad par yod par 'gyur ro zhes khyad par la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if the apprehension of the universal is preceded by the perception of the particulars, then it apprehends in connection with that, and the universal is in that which has the particulars, so it engages the particulars.

original: khyad par rtogs pa med pa de nyid ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa med pa de nyid ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that be without the cognition of the particulars?

original: de ni spyi las rjes su dpog pa'i rtogs pa gsal ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi las rjes su dpog pa'i rtogs pa gsal ba rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be the cognition of the clear image that is inferred from the universal.

original: de ltar yin na rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa las gsal bar rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang spyi rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yin na rjes su dpag pa'i rjes su dpag pa las gsal bar rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir de'i tshe yang spyi rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If that were so, then since the clear image is cognized by the inference of the inference, at that time the universal would also be cognized.

original: spyi de las kyang gsal ba'i spyi gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: spyi de las kyang gsal ba'i spyi gzhan rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: and from that, a more clear universal is understood, so there is no end.

original: ci ste yang mthar gsal ba rtogs na /
analyzed: ci ste yang mthar gsal ba rtogs na /
translated: But if finally a clear one is understood,

original: de lta yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir dang po nyid rtogs par 'gyur bas brgyud pa'i dub pas ci bya /
analyzed: de lta yin na khyad par med pa'i phyir dang po nyid rtogs par 'gyur bas brgyud pa'i dub pas ci bya /
translated: then since there would be no difference, the first one would be understood, so what is the use of the trouble of a series?

original: gsal ba rtogs na ni don bya ba thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs na ni don bya ba thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: But if a clear one is understood, then it would be engaged in order to accomplish all the aims of the clear one.

original: de'i phyir spyi ni blos bkod pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol yin no zhes ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni blos bkod pa nyid yin gyi phyi rol yin no zhes ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable to say that the universal is only posited by the mind and is not external.

original: gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na ci ltar phyi rol la @215a * //üîΩ'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i rang bzhin rtogs pa na ci ltar phyi rol la @215a * // 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the nature of the mind is understood, how can it engage in the external?

original: de lta bu nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the state of cause and effect is seen just as it is.

original: 'o na nged kyi yang spyi rtogs pas gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na nged kyi yang spyi rtogs pas gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Well, in our case also, the clear one is engaged in by understanding the universal,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'dar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni 'dar yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the state of cause and effect is the same.

original: 'di ni aa ru ra zos nas lhas 'khru bar byas so zhes pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni aa ru ra zos nas lhas 'khru bar byas so zhes pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: This is like saying that one is washed by the gods after taking myrobalan.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid yin na bar gyi spyi rbog rbog pos ci bya /üîΩde'i phyir spyi kun kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid yin na bar gyi spyi rbog rbog pos ci bya / de'i phyir spyi kun kun rdzob tu //
translated: If it is the nature of cause and effect, what is the use of the intermediate universal?

original: yod pa yin zhes bzung bar gyis //
analyzed: yod pa yin zhes bzung bar gyis //
translated: Therefore, understand that the universal exists conventionally.

original: spyi ni dngos por yod na ni //
analyzed: spyi ni dngos por yod na ni //
translated: If the universal exists as a thing,

original: 'jug dang ldog pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug dang ldog pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there would be no engagement or disengagement.

original: spyi khas len bas ni gsal ba rtogs par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: spyi khas len bas ni gsal ba rtogs par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: One must accept that the manifestation is understood through the acceptance of the universal.

original: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'jug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no engagement.

original: gsal ba rtogs na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags de nyid las 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs na du ba la sogs pa'i rtags de nyid las 'gyur mod /
translated: If the manifestation is understood, it is understood from that very sign such as smoke, etc.

original: spyi ci zhig bya /
analyzed: spyi ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of the universal?

original: spyis kyang rtags su gyur pa de nyid las de rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyis kyang rtags su gyur pa de nyid las de rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The universal is understood from that very sign.

original: ci ste rtags su gyur pa'i gsal ba gsal ba gzhan dag lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: ci ste rtags su gyur pa'i gsal ba gsal ba gzhan dag lhan cig rjes su 'gro ba med la /
translated: But if the manifestation that is the sign does not accompany other manifestations,

original: spyi la ni yod de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la ni yod de khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the universal exists, because it is all-pervading.

original: des na spyi khas len to zhe na /
analyzed: des na spyi khas len to zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the universal is accepted.

original: de ni de ltar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni de ltar mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: spyi ni khyab pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: spyi ni khyab pa nyid yin yang /
translated: Although the universal is pervasive,

original: de bzhin du ni gzung med par //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzung med par //
translated: it is not apprehended as such.

original: gsal ba gzhan ni go byed du //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan ni go byed du //
translated: Another instance of the universal is not the illuminator,

original: de nyid du na ci ltar 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid du na ci ltar 'dod //
translated: so how could it be accepted as such?

original: gal te khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang de'i rjes su dpog pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i khyab par bya ba ma grub na ci ltar de khyab par byed pa yin par 'dzin /
analyzed: gal te khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang de'i rjes su dpog pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i khyab par bya ba ma grub na ci ltar de khyab par byed pa yin par 'dzin /
translated: If it is pervasive, then when it is inferred, the pervaded is not established. How could it be apprehended as the pervader?

original: 'brel pa ma bzung ba las kyang rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung ba las kyang rtogs na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were understood even without apprehending the relation, that would be absurd.

original: spyi gzhan gyi gsal ba yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi gzhan gyi gsal ba yang rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the other instances of the universal would also be understood.

original: 'on te de dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs na /
analyzed: 'on te de dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs na /
translated: But if you reply that it is not related to that,

original: de lta na ni 'brel pa ma bzung bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'brel pa ma bzung bas kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be understood even without apprehending the relation.

original: gzhan yang de ji ltar rtogs par bya ba zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yang de ji ltar rtogs par bya ba zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Moreover, how is it to be understood? This was explained earlier.

original: gzhan yang gal te spyi las gsal ba rtogs na sgra las kyang spyi rtogs pas //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te spyi las gsal ba rtogs na sgra las kyang spyi rtogs pas //
translated: Moreover, if the particular were understood from the universal, then the universal would be understood from the word.üîΩ

original: de las kyang gsal ba ci ste thob par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de las kyang gsal ba ci ste thob par mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if the particular is understood from the universal, then since the universal is understood from the word, why is the particular not also obtained from that?

original: rtogs pa de ni mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa de ni mi bden pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that that understanding is not true,

original: 'o na spyi'i rtogs thams cad mi bden pas spyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i rtogs thams cad mi bden pas spyis ci zhig bya /
translated: then since all understanding of the universal is not true, what is the use of the universal?

original: gal te spyi ni thams cad du yang yod do //üîΩgsal ba ma rtogs pa ni mi slu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyi ni thams cad du yang yod do // gsal ba ma rtogs pa ni mi slu ba ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the universal exists in everything,

original: don byed par nus pa ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed par nus pa ni gsal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the particular is not nondeceptive because it is the particular that is able to perform a function.

original: spyi med par mi @215b rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi med par mi @215b rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is not possible to understand without a universal,

original: spyi khas len to //
analyzed: spyi khas len to //
translated: we accept the universal.

original: gsal ba ma rtogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba ma rtogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa'i rtags med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the particular is not understood because there is no sign that is related to it,

original: rtags kyis kyang spyi nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtags kyis kyang spyi nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: then does not the sign also cause the understanding of the universal?

original: gal te de la gsal ba rtogs pa yod na ci ste thams cad ma yin /
analyzed: gal te de la gsal ba rtogs pa yod na ci ste thams cad ma yin /
translated: If you say that if the particular is understood, why is it not understood by all,

original: sgras ni spyi tsam rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgras ni spyi tsam rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then we say that the word causes the understanding of the universal alone.

original: 'o na rtags las ni gsal ba rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rtags las ni gsal ba rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, it would be the case that the individual is understood from the reason.

original: de lta na yang skyon sdar bshad pa nyid do //üîΩ'on te gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi la skyon du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang skyon sdar bshad pa nyid do // 'on te gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi la skyon du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even so, the previously explained error would apply.üîΩBut if you think that the error applies to a universal that is different from the individual,

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la ni skyon med do snyam na /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid la ni skyon med do snyam na /
translated: but there is no error in the case of the nature of both,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that also is not correct.

original: gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skyon ;üîΩ/ phyogs 'di la yang med dam ci //
analyzed: gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skyon ; / phyogs 'di la yang med dam ci //
translated: The error that the individual is understood

original: spyi de las kyang gsal ba la /
analyzed: spyi de las kyang gsal ba la /
translated: would also apply to this position.üîΩAnd also, the universal is not understood

original: ma reg par ni rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: ma reg par ni rtogs ma yin //
translated: without contacting the individual.

original: gal te spyi gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang rtogs par byed pas gsal ba rtogs sam /
analyzed: gal te spyi gsal ba las tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'dod pa de'i tshe yang rtogs par byed pas gsal ba rtogs sam /
translated: If you assert that the universal is different or not different from the individual, then in that case, it would be understood by the understanding of the individual.

original: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshul gnyis las mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on te de lta ma yin zhes bya ba'i tshul gnyis las mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not like that.

original: rtogs so zhe na ni nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs so zhe na ni nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If you say that it is understood, then because it would be experienced,üîΩwhy would it not be engaged?

original: ci ste 'jug / gal te ma rtogs na yang 'jug pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ste 'jug / gal te ma rtogs na yang 'jug pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it is not understood, how could it be engaged?

original: rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa yod pas na 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs kyang ma rtogs pa yod pas na 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because there is realization and non-realization,

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal te ;
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa dang ma rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal te ;
translated: then it is contradictory to say that it is both realized and not realized as the nature of that.

original: gcig la rnam grangs med par sgrub pa dang / dgag pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la rnam grangs med par sgrub pa dang / dgag pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid du 'grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that one is both the nature of an affirmation and a negation without distinction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs kyis tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam grangs kyis tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is different by way of enumeration.

original: rnam grangs 'gas ni tha dad par rtogs pa la gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'gas ni tha dad par rtogs pa la gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhung yin no zhe na /
translated: The treatise says, ‚ÄúIt is realized as different by some enumerations, but not by others.‚Äù

original: gang gis ma rtogs pa de'i don du ji ltar 'jug //
analyzed: gang gis ma rtogs pa de'i don du ji ltar 'jug //
translated: If you say that it is for the sake of those who do not realize it, how can it be engaged?

original: de ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyi rnam grangs yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is an enumeration of thatness,

original: ma rtogs na ci ltar de nyid kyis zhes rtogs /
analyzed: ma rtogs na ci ltar de nyid kyis zhes rtogs /
translated: how can it be realized as thatness if it is not realized?

original: rtogs pa la yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir skyon de nyid la ni 'jug go //
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang mi 'jug pa'i phyir skyon de nyid la ni 'jug go //
translated: If it is realized, then the error is that it is engaged.

original: des na chos can gyi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na chos can gyi mtshan nyid ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the definition of the subject is that it exists conventionally.

original: de ltar na 'o na sgra mi rtag ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na sgra mi rtag ste /
translated: Well then, it follows that Sound is impermanent

original: sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgra nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: because of being sound is also a correct reason.

original: gang gi spyi tha dad pa yin pa de la yang bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos por ci ste mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi spyi tha dad pa yin pa de la yang bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi dngos por ci ste mi 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: But why would it not be the case that whatever has a different universal also has the property of probandum and probans?

original: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid de /üîΩspyi dang ldan pa de ni chos can gyi sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid de / spyi dang ldan pa de ni chos can gyi sgra nyid kyis bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the very one part of the meaning of the thesisüîΩthat possesses the universal is indicated by the word subject.

original: 'o na 'dir @216a * //
analyzed: 'o na 'dir @216a * //
translated: Well then, here too, because of being sound is a correct reason.

original: yang de las gzhan las ldog pa bstan zin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de las gzhan las ldog pa bstan zin pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the exclusion from that which is other than that has already been indicated.üîΩThat which possesses a universal

original: spyi dang ldan pa 'am gzhan las ni //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa 'am gzhan las ni //
translated: or is excluded from that which is other

original: ldog pa de ni rtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: ldog pa de ni rtogs pa nyid //
translated: is understood to be that very thing.

original: spyi dang ldan pa de rig pa //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa de rig pa //
translated: If that which possesses a universal is known,

original: med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: med pa rtogs par mi 'gyur nyid //
translated: it is not known to be nonexistent.

original: de yi rang bzhin rtogs na ni //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin rtogs na ni //
translated: If its nature is known,

original: sngar nyid du ni bzlog zin to ;
analyzed: sngar nyid du ni bzlog zin to ;
translated: it has already been excluded.

original: / de'i phyir 'di ni sgra dag las //
analyzed: / de'i phyir 'di ni sgra dag las //
translated: Therefore, from the words

original: ldog pa nyid ni rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid ni rtogs pa yin //
translated: the exclusion from that which is other is understood.

original: gal te sgras khyad par rnams spyi dang ldan par rtogs pa yin no zhes khas len na /
analyzed: gal te sgras khyad par rnams spyi dang ldan par rtogs pa yin no zhes khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the word causes one to understand the universals as qualified by the particulars,

original: 'o na de ltar gsal ba ma rtogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gsal ba ma rtogs pa rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that one would understand what one did not understand.

original: gang la mgron bya ba de nyid la sder chag po sbyin par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la mgron bya ba de nyid la sder chag po sbyin par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to give a broken dish to the very person to whom one is giving a dish.

original: khyad par rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo yang rtogs par 'os pa ma yin no zhes sngar nyid du gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyis rang gi ngo bo yang rtogs par 'os pa ma yin no zhes sngar nyid du gtan la phab zin to //
translated: It has already been established that the particulars themselves are not fit to be understood.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa nyid sgra'i don yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore it remains the case that the exclusion itself is the meaning of the word.

original: gal te ldog pa yang ldog pa'i dngos por rtogs par byed par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa yang ldog pa'i dngos por rtogs par byed par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: If the exclusion is what causes one to understand the thing that is excluded, how is it understood?

original: gal te rtogs pa yod na yang ldog pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa yod na yang ldog pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Even if it is understood, what use is the exclusion?

original: 'on kyang gzhan du mi 'thad pas ldog par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan du mi 'thad pas ldog par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But since it is not tenable in any other way, it is understood as an exclusion.

original: ci ste spyi khas mi len zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste spyi khas mi len zhe na /
translated: If you do not accept universals,

original: rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas len pa'i phyir spyi khas mi len to //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas len pa'i phyir spyi khas mi len to //
translated: we do not accept universals because we follow what is understood.

original: ci 'jig rten na ngas ldog par rtogs so snyam du rtogs pa yod dam zhe na mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pas rtogs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: ci 'jig rten na ngas ldog par rtogs so snyam du rtogs pa yod dam zhe na mi 'dra ba nyid du rtogs pas rtogs pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: ‚ÄúBut is there any understanding in the world that one understands the opposite of what one has understood?‚Äù There is, because one understands a difference.

original: 'di ltar gal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te /
translated: Thus, if

original: dngos po mi 'dod spangs nas ni //
analyzed: dngos po mi 'dod spangs nas ni //
translated: one does not understand the thing that is the opposite of what is not desired,

original: ldog par sgra las rtogs min na //üîΩrnam par phye bas rab tu ni //
analyzed: ldog par sgra las rtogs min na // rnam par phye bas rab tu ni //
translated: one does not understand the word that is the opposite of what is not desired.üîΩAnd if one does not understand the word that is the opposite of what is not desired,

original: 'jug pa dang ni ldan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ni ldan mi 'gyur //
translated: one cannot understand the engagement of the word that is the opposite of what is not desired.

original: gdon mi za bar rigs mi mthun pa dang / 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur te de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar rigs mi mthun pa dang / 'di 'dra ba'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur te de lta ma yin na /
translated: One must understand that the word that is the opposite of what is not desired is of a different kind from the word that is not the opposite of what is not desired. Otherwise,

original: mi 'dod pa spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one would not understand the engagement of the word that is the opposite of what is not desired.üîΩBut if the word that is the opposite of what is not desired is a universal,

original: de ni mi 'dod pa dang mi 'dra ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod pa dang mi 'dra ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: then it is not the word that is the opposite of what is not desired.

original: rang nyid de ltar gyur pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rang nyid de ltar gyur pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not itself like that,

original: chos gzhan dang ldan yang ci ltar na de ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: chos gzhan dang ldan yang ci ltar na de ltar 'gyur /
translated: then how could it be like that even though it has another property?

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir na 'di de ltar rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir na 'di de ltar rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If one understands it because it has that,üîΩthen it is not the word that is the opposite of what is not desired.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pas rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa ma yin pa ni rtogs pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pas rang gi ngo bor rtogs pa ma yin pa ni rtogs pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: But if it is not endowed with something other than that, it is not reasonable to understand it as an essence.

original: rang gi ngo bo mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mi mthun pa nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is understood as having an essence that is not similar,

original: 'o na ni spyi gzhan dang ldan pa don med do //
analyzed: 'o na ni spyi gzhan dang ldan pa don med do //
translated: then it is pointless for the universal to be endowed with something other.

original: gal te spyi med par tha dad pa de nyid mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi med par tha dad pa de nyid mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that without a universal, that very difference is not understood,

original: 'o na spyi rnams kyi khyad par ga las @216b rtogs spyi gzhan dang ldan na ni thug pa med do //
analyzed: 'o na spyi rnams kyi khyad par ga las @216b rtogs spyi gzhan dang ldan na ni thug pa med do //
translated: then how is the difference of universals understood? If the universal is endowed with something other, there is an infinite regress.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'dra ba yin na gsal ba rnams kyang de lta bu nyad du thal bas spyi don med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'dra ba yin na gsal ba rnams kyang de lta bu nyad du thal bas spyi don med do //
translated: If it is dissimilar by its very essence, then it follows that the manifestations are also like that, so the universal is pointless.

original: gang gi tshe gnyis tha dad par rtogs pa de'i tshe ci ltar gcig la ni spyi gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnyis tha dad par rtogs pa de'i tshe ci ltar gcig la ni spyi gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: When the two are understood as different, then how is it that one is not the locus of the universal?

original: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dis gsal ba rnams tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'dis gsal ba rnams tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that by this the manifestations are understood as different.

original: rigs mi mthun pa nyid las tha dad pa de yang thams cad la yod pa'i phyir de nyid spyi yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa nyid las tha dad pa de yang thams cad la yod pa'i phyir de nyid spyi yin no //
translated: And since that difference from what is dissimilar exists in everything, that itself is the universal.

original: gal te spyi med na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa tha dad pa de nyid ci ltar /
analyzed: gal te spyi med na rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa tha dad pa de nyid ci ltar /
translated: If the universal does not exist, how can there be a difference between what is similar and what is dissimilar?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gsal ba phan tshun tha dad kyi //üîΩphan tshun spyi ni yod min na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gsal ba phan tshun tha dad kyi // phan tshun spyi ni yod min na //
translated: The difference of the particulars is notüîΩthe universal of the particulars.

original: gsal ba tha dad 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: The difference of the particulars

original: de ni rtogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de ni rtogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: is not perceived.

original: gsal ba la ltos pas tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba la ltos pas tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the difference is dependent on the particulars,

original: ci ltar ba lang khra bo dang ser skya dag rta dang ba las tha dad pa de bzhin du rta dang ba dang khra bo yang ser skya las tha dad pa'i phyir de gnyis kyang rigs mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci ltar ba lang khra bo dang ser skya dag rta dang ba las tha dad pa de bzhin du rta dang ba dang khra bo yang ser skya las tha dad pa'i phyir de gnyis kyang rigs mthun pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur /
translated: then just as the variegated and tawny cows are different from the horse and the donkey, so the horse and the donkey are also different from the tawny cow. Therefore it follows that those two are similar.

original: gang gis thams cad bsdoms te brda byas pas rnam bar phye bar gyur pa thams cad mthong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis thams cad bsdoms te brda byas pas rnam bar phye bar gyur pa thams cad mthong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And since one does not see all the particulars that are combined and designated,

original: des na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: that also is not logical.

original: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not unreasonable.üîΩIn this way:

original: 'di ltar / spyi ni yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: 'di ltar / spyi ni yod pa yin na yang //
translated: Even if the universal exists,

original: nyes pa 'di ni bzlog pa med //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni bzlog pa med //
translated: this fault is not averted.

original: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya //
analyzed: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya //
translated: The universal is manifested by the particulars,

original: 'dod kyi rang gi ngo bos min //üîΩgsal bas stong pas phyogs sogs su //
analyzed: 'dod kyi rang gi ngo bos min // gsal bas stong pas phyogs sogs su //
translated: but not by its own nature.üîΩSince the universal is empty of the particulars,

original: de ni gsal ba mthong med phyir //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba mthong med phyir //
translated: it is not seen in the directions, etc.

original: des na gsal ba nyid la ni //
analyzed: des na gsal ba nyid la ni //
translated: Therefore, the universal itself

original: ltos bya de yang kun mthong med //üîΩdes na de yang brda yi ni //
analyzed: ltos bya de yang kun mthong med // des na de yang brda yi ni //
translated: is not seen by anyone.üîΩTherefore, it is also not established as a particular

original: byed pas khyad par 'grub mi 'gyur //üîΩspyi yang rtogs nas brdar bya pa'am //
analyzed: byed pas khyad par 'grub mi 'gyur // spyi yang rtogs nas brdar bya pa'am //
translated: because it is the basis of a convention.üîΩThe universal is either known and then the convention is made,

original: tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: or the convention is made and then it is known.

original: gsal ba med par ni spyi nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba med par ni spyi nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal is not indicated without the particulars.

original: gsal ba mtha' dag mthong na ni spyi nges pa mthong ba'i phyir brda 'chol ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba mtha' dag mthong na ni spyi nges pa mthong ba'i phyir brda 'chol ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If all the particulars are seen, then the universal is ascertained and seen, so the convention would not be confused.

original: de'i tshe yang ni spyi ni don med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang ni spyi ni don med pa nyid de /
translated: Even at that time, the universal is meaningless,

original: gsal ba rnams nyid dngos su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams nyid dngos su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the particulars themselves are directly seen.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba gcig mthong nas 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes brdar byas pas ji ltar so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba gcig mthong nas 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes brdar byas pas ji ltar so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs /
translated: Having seen a single instance of clarity, one designates it as a cow. How does one understand a universal that is individually ascertained?

original: phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dag la ni spyi 'ga' yang tha dad par ma rtogs par brjod do //
analyzed: phyugs nyid la sogs pa'i spyi dag la ni spyi 'ga' yang tha dad par ma rtogs par brjod do //
translated: It is said that in the case of universals such as cowness, no universal is understood as distinct.

original: ba lang nyid tsam brda'i yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid tsam brda'i yul yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that cowness alone is the referent of the term,

original: ba lang nyid de gang yin zhes mi shes so//
analyzed: ba lang nyid de gang yin zhes mi shes so//
translated: we do not know what cowness is.

original: @217a * // ci ltar bya ste gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: @217a * // ci ltar bya ste gang zhig 'di lta bur gyur pa'i gsal bas gsal bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: How can it be? It is that which is made known by an instance that is like this.

original: gsal ba 'di lta bur gyur ba ni des yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba 'di lta bur gyur ba ni des yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since this instance is like that, the error of mutual dependence arises.

original: spyi de rtogs na ni gsal ba rnams gcig nyid gsal ba rnams yin na yang so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi de rtogs na ni gsal ba rnams gcig nyid gsal ba rnams yin na yang so sor nges pa'i spyi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: If that universal is understood, then the instances are one. If the instances are one, the universal that is individually ascertained is understood.

original: ba lang la yang zhes rang nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ba lang la yang zhes rang nyid tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is also a cow, it would be different from itself.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: ba lang zhes bya ba'i spyi rta ngang pa la sogs pa las mi 'jug pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba'i spyi rta ngang pa la sogs pa las mi 'jug pa nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal ‚Äúox‚Äù is understood by the mere non-engagement of the mind in regard to horse, swan, etc.

original: gang la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba de nyid la ba lang nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: gang la ba lang ngo zhes bya ba'i blor 'gyur ba de nyid la ba lang nyid du rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say: ‚ÄúThat very thing in regard to which the idea ‚Äòox‚Äô occurs is understood as ‚Äòox-ness,‚Äô‚Äù

original: gzhal bya shes pa med pa'i blos ji ltar gzhal bya rtogs /
analyzed: gzhal bya shes pa med pa'i blos ji ltar gzhal bya rtogs /
translated: how can the object be understood by a cognition that does not know the object?

original: kha dog dang dbyibs las tha dad ba'i gzhal bya mtshungs pa ni rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs las tha dad ba'i gzhal bya mtshungs pa ni rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no cognition of an object that is different from color and shape.

original: de nyid spyi yin te /
analyzed: de nyid spyi yin te /
translated: If you say: ‚ÄúThat very thing is the universal,

original: rjes su sogs ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su sogs ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the basis of the idea of ‚Äòox,‚Äô‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no concomitance.

original: kha dog ni gsal ba gzhan la rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog ni gsal ba gzhan la rjes su song ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Color is not the nature of the universal that occurs in other particulars,

original: gsal ba gcig mthong na yang de'i rjes su song bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig mthong na yang de'i rjes su song bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it follows that even when one particular is seen, the universal is understood.

original: de ltar yin dang gsal ba thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang gsal ba thams cad rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it follows that all particulars would be understood.

original: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ni gsal bas gsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the universal is not manifested by the particulars, it is not manifested at all.

original: 'o na ni gtan mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni gtan mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not manifested by the particulars, it is not manifested at all.

original: ji tsam mthong ba tsam la rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam mthong ba tsam la rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if it is manifested by the particulars, it is manifested by just as much as is seen.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not manifested by just as much as is seen.

original: spyi la ni de tsam nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la ni de tsam nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal does not exist in just as much as is seen.

original: de lta bu yin na ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu yin na ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: If it were manifested by just as much as is seen, it would not be a universal.

original: gsal ba nyid yin pas spyi gzhan med do //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid yin pas spyi gzhan med do //
translated: It would be a particular, because it would not be different from the universal.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid spyi yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na ni /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i shes pa bskyed pa nyid spyi yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na ni /
translated: If you say that the universal is the production of a cognition that is like itself,

original: de gzhan las ldog pa nyid spyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gzhan las ldog pa nyid spyir 'gyur ro //
translated: then the universal is the exclusion of the other.

original: mad po rnams kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pa nyid spyi yin gyi de dang rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa tsam las gzhan pa'i spyi de ni 'di yin no zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mad po rnams kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pa nyid spyi yin gyi de dang rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa tsam las gzhan pa'i spyi de ni 'di yin no zhes bstan par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The realists say that the universal is the exclusion of the other, but they cannot demonstrate that the universal is something other than the mere exclusion of what is not similar to it.

original: rigs mi mthun pa ni cig shos las log pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa ni cig shos las log pa nyid yin la /
translated: What is dissimilar is the opposite of the other.

original: ji ltar gcig pa dang tha dad pa de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan du mthong ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig pa dang tha dad pa de'i phyir gzhan dang gzhan du mthong ba yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Because of being the same and different, therefore, it is seen as different from another, but not as another.

original: spyi ni 'di yin no zhes bstan par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni 'di yin no zhes bstan par nus pa yin te /
translated: It is possible to indicate a universal, saying, ‚ÄúThis is it.‚ÄùüîΩIt is not possible to indicate a particular, saying, ‚ÄúThis is it.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir bstan par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a response to say that it is not possible to indicate a particular because it is not different from another,

original: med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it would then follow that it would not exist.

original: gsal ba 'gags nas ni spyi rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba 'gags nas ni spyi rnam par gzhag par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to posit a universal after a particular has ceased,

original: tha @217b snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha @217b snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would then be without a convention.

original: spyi ni gsal yang de lta bu nyid do zhes ni mi rigs te ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad kyang yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi ni gsal yang de lta bu nyid do zhes ni mi rigs te ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad kyang yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that a universal is just like a particular, because a convention that has a reason for exclusion also exists.

original: las rdzas ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: las rdzas ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like saying, ‚ÄúAn action is not a substance.‚Äù

original: spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yang ldog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yang ldog pa nyid yin no //
translated: The reason for the convention of mutual difference of universals is also exclusion.

original: 'on te spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha snyad kyi rgyu ni gsal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi rnams kyi phan tshun tha snyad kyi rgyu ni gsal ba dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the reason for the mutual convention of universals is the possession of an individual,üîΩthen even so, the error still remains.

original: de lta yin na yang skyon yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta yin na yang skyon yod pa nyid de /
translated: For,

original: 'di ltar / ngo bos tha dad yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ngo bos tha dad yod ma yin //
translated: There is no difference by own nature.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis tha dad 'gyur //
translated: How can there be difference by another?

original: dkar por ldan phyir snam bu ni //
analyzed: dkar por ldan phyir snam bu ni //
translated: Because it possesses whiteness, the cloth

original: dkar po yin zhes rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: dkar po yin zhes rab tu bsgrags //
translated: is well known as white.

original: gzhan gyi tha dad pa ni gzhan dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tha dad pa ni gzhan dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Difference by another does not become possession of another.

original: spyi dang gsal ba dag 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dang gsal ba dag 'phrod pa 'du bas 'brel pa'i phyir ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is possession because of the connection of the universal and the individual by the contact of their combination,

original: spyi tha dad pa med pa gsal ba la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams nyid tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa med pa gsal ba la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams nyid tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because of the contact of the universal with the individual without difference, the individuals themselves would be without difference.

original: des na spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yang rta la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na spyi thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ba lang yang rta la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the possession of all universals, a cow would be a horse, etc.

original: gzhan yang ba lang gi spyi ni ba lang nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ba lang gi spyi ni ba lang nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, the universal of cow is cow itself.

original: gsal ba rnams kyang rang gi ngo bos rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa de'i phyir 'di ltar gsal ba spyi gzhan tha dad par byed pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams kyang rang gi ngo bos rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa phan tshun tha dad pa med pa de'i phyir 'di ltar gsal ba spyi gzhan tha dad par byed pa nyid yin /
translated: Also, in terms of their own nature, the manifestations are not mutually different, either as being of the same type or as being of different types. Therefore, in this way, the manifestation itself is the differentiator of other universals.

original: 'on te gsal ba rnams rang gi ngo bos rigs mi mthun pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba rnams rang gi ngo bos rigs mi mthun pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: But if the manifestations are different from each other in terms of their own nature,

original: 'o na tha dad pa med pa de nyid spyi yin la rag mod /
analyzed: 'o na tha dad pa med pa de nyid spyi yin la rag mod /
translated: then it is certainly the case that they are not different from each other, and that is the universal.

original: gzhan gyis ci bya spyi khas blangs kyang gsal ba la tha dad pa de nyid spyi spyi gzhan dag las 'byed par byed pa yin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci bya spyi khas blangs kyang gsal ba la tha dad pa de nyid spyi spyi gzhan dag las 'byed par byed pa yin par 'gyur bas /
translated: What is the point of positing another universal? Even if you accept a universal, the manifestation itself, which is not different from the other manifestations, would be the differentiator of other universals.

original: 'o na spyi'i khyad par ni grub pa nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i khyad par ni grub pa nye bar 'jog pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the particular of a universal is posited as the universal.

original: de spyi ni rang gi ngo bos spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: de spyi ni rang gi ngo bos spyi gzhan las tha dad pa yin la /
translated: That universal is different from other universals in terms of its own nature.

original: spyi dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan pas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan pas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: That which possesses the universal is different from that which possesses it.

original: dper na dkar po'i rang bzhin ni rang nyid kho nas yin la /
analyzed: dper na dkar po'i rang bzhin ni rang nyid kho nas yin la /
translated: For example, the nature of white is just that.

original: snam bu ni de dang ldan pa las yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: snam bu ni de dang ldan pa las yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: And cloth is so called because it possesses that.üîΩ

original: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / kha dog dkar po'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: de yang 'thad pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / kha dog dkar po'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: But that is not tenable.üîΩFor,üîΩThe nature of white is never perceived

original: 'ba' zhig 'gar yang rtogs pa med //üîΩde nas de yi dang nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig 'gar yang rtogs pa med // de nas de yi dang nyid kyis //
translated: apart from the thing that is white.üîΩThen, how can the nature of white

original: dkar po'i ngo bor ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: dkar po'i ngo bor ji ltar rtogs //
translated: be perceived as the entity of white?

original: dkar po la sogs pa ni rtag tu rdzas la gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa ni rtag tu rdzas la gnas pa nyid do //
translated: White, etc., always exist in substance.

original: des logs su blta bar mi rung ba dag rang nyid de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: des logs su blta bar mi rung ba dag rang nyid de'i rang bzhin yin no zhes ji ltar 'ga' zhig gis rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can anyone know that the things that are not suitable to be seen separately are themselves the nature of that?

original: de'i dkar po nyid de ni rdzas nyid las yin no zhes /
analyzed: de'i dkar po nyid de ni rdzas nyid las yin no zhes /
translated: If you say that the whiteness of that is substance,

original: ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: why don‚Äôt you accept that?

original: gal te de'i dkar po nyid rdzas @218a * //
analyzed: gal te de'i dkar po nyid rdzas @218a * //
translated: If the whiteness of that is substance,

original: yin na / 'o na de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin na / 'o na de'i rang gi ngo bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is its own nature?

original: 'o na rdzas kyi ngo bo yang gang yin zhes nyes pa de nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na rdzas kyi ngo bo yang gang yin zhes nyes pa de nyid do //
translated: Then the same error arises: ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of substance?‚Äù

original: rdzas so zhes de ltar rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas so zhes de ltar rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that substance is known in that way,

original: rdzas zhes bya ba yang kha dog dang dbyibs la ma reg pa rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: rdzas zhes bya ba yang kha dog dang dbyibs la ma reg pa rtogs pa med do //
translated: And substance is not perceived apart from color and shape.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyang yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rdzas ji ltar rtogs pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyang yon tan nyid yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan du 'gyur ba'i rdzas ji ltar rtogs pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: And color and shape are qualities, so how can substance, which is different from them, be the object of perception?

original: dbyibs kyang kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa la rten par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang kha dog la sogs pa las tha dad pa la rten par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Shape is not perceived apart from color, etc.

original: kha dog nyid de ltar zlum po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog nyid de ltar zlum po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba yin no //
translated: It is just color that appears in the form of a circle, etc.

original: gal te rdzas kyang snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyang snang ba nyid de /
translated: If substance is perceived,

original: 'di ltar reg pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang bum pa de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa'i rnam par shes pas kyang bum pa de nyid ni 'di yin no zhes gcig nyid du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the consciousness of touch would perceive the same thing, and the object would appear as one.

original: yon tan tsam ni ngo shes pa ma yin te de ma yin no gzugs la reg go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon tan tsam ni ngo shes pa ma yin te de ma yin no gzugs la reg go zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the mere quality is not recognized, for it is not said, ‚ÄúI touch the color.‚Äù

original: reg pa'i yul ni gzugs yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: reg pa'i yul ni gzugs yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the object of touch is form.

original: des na rdzas nyid ngo bo shes par rig pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rdzas nyid ngo bo shes par rig pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, substance itself is the object of perception.

original: des na gang zhig gang las tha dad pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba de ni de las tha dad pa yin te dper na bum pa las snam bu bzhin rdzas kyang tha dad pa'i yul can gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba
analyzed: des na gang zhig gang las tha dad pa'i yul can gyi rnam par shes pas gzung bar bya ba de ni de las tha dad pa yin te dper na bum pa las snam bu bzhin rdzas kyang tha dad pa'i yul can gyi shes pas gzung bar bya ba
translated: A substance is apprehended by a consciousness that has a different object.

original: yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na /
analyzed: yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so zhe na /
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gzugs sogs las gzhan don la ni //
analyzed: gzugs sogs las gzhan don la ni //
translated: The object that is different from form and so on

original: ngo shes pa ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni mthong ba med //
translated: is not seen by recognition.

original: dran pa med par snga ma ni //
analyzed: dran pa med par snga ma ni //
translated: Without memory, the former

original: rtogs pa'i spyod yul 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i spyod yul 'gyur ma yin //
translated: is not the object of realization.

original: ri zhig mthong ba la ni bum pa la sogs pa snang ba med do //
analyzed: ri zhig mthong ba la ni bum pa la sogs pa snang ba med do //
translated: When a mountain is seen, a pot and so on do not appear.

original: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dang po ma yin te /
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dang po ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness of touch is not the first,

original: dang po ni yan lag tsam snang ngo //
analyzed: dang po ni yan lag tsam snang ngo //
translated: because the first only appears as a part.

original: de ni yan lag gzhan med kyang de kho na ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: de ni yan lag gzhan med kyang de kho na ltar snang ngo //
translated: Even without another part, it appears just like that.

original: de ni bum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bum pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not a pot.

original: phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i yan lag ma lus pa la khyab pa'i yan lag can bum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs kyi rnam par dbye ba dang ldan pa'i yan lag ma lus pa la khyab pa'i yan lag can bum pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the pot is the whole that pervades all the parts that have directional dimensions.

original: gzugs tsam yang bum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs tsam yang bum pa ma yin te /
translated: But the mere form is not the pot,

original: gzugs kyi 'du ba can gyi rgyu de ltar brjod pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du ba can gyi rgyu de ltar brjod pa'i phyir dang / de'i tshe ngo shes pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of the aggregation of form is described in that way, and because recognition does not exist at that time.

original: 'on te yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dag dang yon tan gzhan la sogs pa snang ba na yan lag can 'dzin pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag gzhan dang gzhan dag dang yon tan gzhan la sogs pa snang ba na yan lag can 'dzin pa yin no zhes 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that when the other parts and other qualities and so on appear, the whole is apprehended,

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar / de tshe phyogs gcig gzhan dag nyid //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar / de tshe phyogs gcig gzhan dag nyid //
translated: that also does not exist.

original: gzung bar 'gyur ba yin pas na //
analyzed: gzung bar 'gyur ba yin pas na //
translated: In that case, the other parts themselves would be apprehended.

original: yan lag @218b can gyi dbyibs dag ni //
analyzed: yan lag @218b can gyi dbyibs dag ni //
translated: Therefore the apprehension of the shape of the whole

original: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: does not exist.

original: de bzhin yon tan gzhan la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin yon tan gzhan la yang //
translated: The same analysis also applies to other qualities.

original: zhig na'ang dran pa skye ba nyid //üîΩrjes dpag las ni rtogs pa gang //
analyzed: zhig na'ang dran pa skye ba nyid // rjes dpag las ni rtogs pa gang //
translated: Even when it is destroyed, memory arises.

original: mngon sum sngon 'gro med par min //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon 'gro med par min //
translated: Understanding from inference is not direct perception, because it is preceded by direct perception.

original: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa la yan lag gzhan dang yon tan gzhan dmigs pa de'i tshe yon tan dang yan lag gzhan ma dmigs na ji ltar yan lag can yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bum pa la sogs pa la yan lag gzhan dang yon tan gzhan dmigs pa de'i tshe yon tan dang yan lag gzhan ma dmigs na ji ltar yan lag can yin /
translated: When a pot, etc. is perceived as having other parts and other qualities, if other qualities and parts are not perceived, how can it be a whole?

original: de tsam nyid ni bum pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid ni bum pa ma yin no //
translated: That much alone is not a pot.

original: 'on te dran pa dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pas bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can yongs su shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran pa dang lhan cig pa'i ngo shes pas bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag can yongs su shes so zhe na /
translated: But if a pot, etc. as a whole is known by recognition that is simultaneous with memory,

original: de'i tshe yan lag dang yon tan gzhan rnam par phye na de la bum pa gang yin zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yan lag dang yon tan gzhan rnam par phye na de la bum pa gang yin zhes bya bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then when other parts and qualities are distinguished, it would be asked, ‚ÄúWhat is a pot?‚Äù

original: phan tshun mi dbye ba ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun mi dbye ba ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-separation of parts and qualities is due to their dependence on the same collection.

original: mi 'bral bar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi 'bral bar 'dzin pa'i tshad ma yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there a valid cognition that apprehends non-separation,

original: phan tshun spangs te dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are mutually exclusive and observed separately.

original: dbyer med pa ni dran pa'i rtogs pa dang ngo shes pa'i rtogs pas gzung bar bya ba yin no//
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni dran pa'i rtogs pa dang ngo shes pa'i rtogs pas gzung bar bya ba yin no//
translated: Non-separateness is apprehended by the cognition of memory and the cognition of recognition.

original: dran pa dang ngo shes pa so sor tshad ma ma yin pa dag ni bsdoms pas tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang ngo shes pa so sor tshad ma ma yin pa dag ni bsdoms pas tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But memory and recognition, which are not valid cognitions individually, do not become valid cognitions by being combined.

original: gal te so sor gdung 'degs par mi nus pa rnams gzhan du nus par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te so sor gdung 'degs par mi nus pa rnams gzhan du nus par mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren‚Äôt there cases where things that are individually incapable of supporting a load are seen to be able to do so when combined?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, there are not.

original: der de rnams 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der de rnams 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they produce an effect.

original: de lta bur gyur pa rgyu snga mas bskyed pa nyid nus pa yin gyi tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa rgyu snga mas bskyed pa nyid nus pa yin gyi tha dad pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The capacity of such things to produce an effect is produced by a previous cause. There is no difference among them.

original: 'dir dran pa dang ngo shes pa gnyis la 'bras bu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'dir dran pa dang ngo shes pa gnyis la 'bras bu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the effect of memory and recognition?

original: yan lag can rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag can rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: The apprehension of the whole.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, there is not.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no apprehension other than that.

original: 'on te nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa gzhan skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa gzhan skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if the apprehension is of a different nature, then another apprehension arises.

original: de ni mi rung ste /üîΩtshad ma yin pa las nges pa ni ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste / tshad ma yin pa las nges pa ni ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: That is not correct.üîΩIf it is ascertained by a valid cognition, it is not non-ascertained.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa las ni nges pa ma yin te /
